She is asking for 14,000 meticais, with which she intends to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and other materials) in order to continue construction on her house. In the future she would like to ask for another loan to finish her house and offer better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron and other materials)

loans.name: Cecilia Jeremias

texts.pt:
Cecília jeremias T. conseguiu comprar todo material que esteve previsto no empréstimo com a Hluvuku e foi para o destino acordado com a instituição.
	
Foi possível pagar o empréstimo em menos tempo do que esteve previsto, isto devido ao aumento da sua receita que chegou a superar as expectativas, motivando assim a duplicar o pagamento do seu calendário de pagamento.

Não verificou nenhuma mudança em sua vida, a não ser o melhoramento do seu negócio.

 Com o presente empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt pretende comprar mercadoria (mesas, cadeiras, camas, mesinha de cabeceira e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial perto da sua casa, como forma de diminuir a distância que percorre ate ao atual local de trabalho.
texts.en:
Cecília Jeremias T. managed to buy all the materials listed on her Hluvuku loan, and it was used as agreed with the institution. It was possible for her to pay off the loan ahead of time, owing to an increase in income which surpassed her expectations, motivating her to make extra payments and pay off the loan early. She did not have any changes in her life other than the improvement of her business. With the current loan of 25,000 meticais, she intends to buy merchandise (tables, chairs, beds, bedside tables and others) to increase her inventory. In the future she would like to ask for more loans to build a commercial establishment near her house, as a way to diminish the distance that she travels to her current place of business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (tables, chairs, beds, bedside tables and other items)

loans.name: Amelia Palmira

texts.pt:
Amélia Palmira F. conseguiu comprar todos produtos que foram previsto no empréstimo com a Hluvuku e foi para o destino acordado com a instituição.
	
Foi possível pagar o empréstimo em tempo previsto sem dificuldades e de acordo com o calendário estabelecido. O seu negócio atualmente teve melhorias consideráveis e não verificou nenhuma mudança em sua vida, a não ser o melhoramento do seu negócio.

 Com o presente empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar produtos de salão de cabeleireiro para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock.

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma mercearia, explorando novas áreas de comércio.
texts.en:
Amélia Palmira F. managed to buy all the products that were listed on her loan with Hluvuku, and they were used for the purpose agreed to with the institution. It was possible to pay off the loan on time, without difficulties, and according to the repayment schedule. Her business currently has considerable improvement, and she did not report any life changes other than the improvement of her business. With this current loan of 20,000 meticais, she intends to purchase hairstyling products to increase her inventory. In the future she would like to ask for more loans to build a grocery store, exploring new areas of commerce.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for hair salon

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet T. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. One of her children is currently in school. Juliet has a business selling cosmetics, which she has had for five years.

Juliet has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda which will be used to purchase oil and additional tins of cosmetics. With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay for school fees. In the future Juliet hopes to own her own house. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to expand her business.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy oil and more tins of cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa Lourenco

texts.pt:
Rosa Lourenço M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos de 7 e 3 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a Escola. Fez o quarto ano na Universidade Pedagógica. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

Nunca sai da sua terra natal, apenas saiu de casa quando se juntou ao seu esposo. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 11 anos é quadro do Ministério da Educação e tem um salario mensal de 5.835.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Ja teve um empréstimo no Banco Millenium Bim para o início da construção da sua casa, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, portas, fechaduras, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
 
No futuro gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma dependência na sua casa como forma de poder albergar mais pessoas da sua família.
texts.en:
Rosa Lourenço M. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is the mother of two children, ages 7 and 3; the eldest goes to school. Rosa finished the fourth year at the Teaching University. She lives in her own house with her family and supports two relatives (nephews or nieces) who live with her. She never left her hometown and had hardly left her house when she married her husband. She has worked as a teacher for more than 11 years. She is employed by the Ministry of Education and has a monthly salary of 5,835 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account. Rosa had a loan before with Millenium Bim Bank to begin construction on her house. Later she decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through co-workers who are customers of the institution. This 17,000 meticais loan is her first. She intends to buy construction materials (cement, doors, locks, sand and other items) to continue construction on her house. In the future Rosa would like to ask for another loan to build a room onto her house as a way to be able to house more family members..

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, doors, locks, sand and other items)

loans.name: Zaituna

texts.en:
Zaituna N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Zaituna sells drinks like passion fruit juice, sodas, and water, a business she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Zaituna has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda with which she will purchase more drinks to sell. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zaituna hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and home materials for her family. In the future, she hopes to own her own cosmetics shop. Zaituna is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her make more of a profit in her business.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Aminosse Alberto

texts.pt:
Aminosse Alberto J. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, não tem filhos ainda, freqüenta 12ª classe, vive na casa dos pais e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha como monitor de informática e criador de aves ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de outros clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para criação de frangos de corte.
 
No futuro gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para aumentar a quantidade de pintos, automaticamente aumentando o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Aminosse Alberto J. was born in the district of Boane, Maputo, in Southern Mozambique, where he still lives with his parents and is responsible for their support as well as the support of a sister. For the last four years, in addition to attending school (he is currently in the last year of secondary school), Aminosse has been in the business of raising chickens (he also works as a computer teacher). He works by himself and earns 4.000.00mt per month, which allows him to support himself and his family and to save some money in the bank. This is the first time he is applying for a loan. He heard about Hluvuku through some clients of the institution. He will use the 15.000.00mt to buy more baby chicks to raise, chicken feed and vitamins. He plans to apply for another loan in the future, to increase the number of chickens he raises and sells and, therefore, his profit.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baby chicks, chicken feed and vitamins

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira M. lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 56 years old, married and has two grown-up children.  She worked for 16 years in a kindergarten as a nurse and was one of the dearest friends to the children.  Zamira’s husband is a metal turner.  

The breaking up of the Soviet Union with its collective farm structure knocked many people out of their habitual way of life, but Zamira considered it a chance to renew her life.  19 years ago, in order to support her family, Zamira began her business of cattle breeding and farming.  She purchased a desolate sheepyard, where her family started to breed livestock. Thanks to persistent work, their livestock expanded and today it amounts to two milch cows, one horse, and 20 sheep. 
  
Zamira plans to use the loan of 55,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing 22 sheep. With the revenue from this investment, Zamira plans to renovate her sheepyard and buy  a cart. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man and father of three school-age children. He lives in Lebanon. Since 1990 he has owned a shop where he sells fertilizers and organic products for agriculture. Situated in an agricultural area, his shop is well known by a good number of farmers who ask for his products.

Today, he wishes to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al. to increase his shop inventory. He wants to be prepared for the new season when all the farmers cultivate their lands for sowing.

loans.use: To increase his shop's inventory

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter W. I. is a young married man with two children who are 10 years old and three years old. His business is located at Chavakali in Kakamega. He provides motorcycle transport to the people of Chavakali. He has been doing this business for three years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he has are financial constraints and the fact that some spare parts are not readily available. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 30,000 to buy motorcycle spare parts to repair his motorcycle so that he can be able to provide good service to his customers. He hopes to own a fleet of motorcycles. He describes himself as honest, cheerful and focused.

loans.use: To motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick A. is 46 years old, single and has three children between 20 and 8 years old. His business is located in a busy market in Kakamega. He has been selling cereals like maize, beans and groundnuts. In the same shop, he sells baskets and fruit. He has been doing this business for 10 years and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled with choice. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more maize, beans and groundnuts to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and become a wholesaler. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Christine has had a business selling charcoal for four years.  Christine generates additional income through her side business roasting maize.  

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more bags of charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Christine hopes to buy an airplane, own a car and a house.  Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by socializing with other young women and reading books. 


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is a construction worker who is especially talented at completing projects that are made of wood. He went into this line of work five years ago and opened his own business in 2007. Despite his youth, he is happy to take on big projects and is making a good reputation for himself in this line of work. Thanks to the income generated by his business, he is now able to help his father meet their family's expenses. He is applying for a $1,000 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy the wood he needs to complete a new building project. In the future, he is planning to expand his business and open up a construction office for his company.

loans.use: to buy wood to complete a construction project

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 30-year-old member of Unity Self Help Group, which is affiliated with Faulu Kenya. For the last two years, she has made a living selling second-hand clothes. She does her selling in the open-air Karen Market and has one employee. She also runs a side business where she sells utensils. In the past, she made a living selling charcoal, and now believes that her growing skills and confidence in the world of business have been enhanced by joining Faulu Kenya.  She has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy clothes and utensils to sell. In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale business and import clothing from other countries.

loans.use: To buy clothing and utensils to sell to her customers

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 26 years old, married and has two children. She makes a living by doing both tailoring and embroidery work, largely for women's outfits and tablecloths. Most of her customers live in her neighborhood. Julia is a member of the Huruma B group, which is part of Faulu Kenya. She previously borrowed 20,000 Kes from the group and is now applying for a new loan, for 30,000 Kes, to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make tablecloths.  She hopes to become a major distributor of tablecloths in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric to make tablecloths

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school. He earns a living by running a retail store, and has one employee who works for him. He is also a part-time farmer, an occupation which he shares with his wife. Joseph dreams of becoming a retailer, and is applying for a loan for 70,000 Kes to expand his business. By taking this step, he hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 45 years old, married and has four children who are 25, 22, 15 and 11 years old. Three of her children are in school. To earn her daily bread, she runs a hardware store. She has been in this business for the last five years, and calls her shop Joy Lenana Hardware. She has one employee, and also makes additional income on the side by running a beauty salon. She is a member of the Unity Self Help Group, which is affiliated with Faulu Kenya.  She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her become more experienced in managing her business and saving her money. Hannah has also benefited by participating in three group loans. She is now applying for a loan for 90,000 Kes to buy nails, iron and bolts to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to open a second hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy nails, iron and bolts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 33 years old and is married with three children. She has been running Happy Daycare school for four years. The school has 134 children with six employees. She was previously employed as a teacher before she opened her own school.

Gladys hopes to be financially stable so as to improve her standard of living. She has benefited from the New Jerusalem group in Faulu Kenya because she has previously been guaranteed two loans. She is requesting another loan of 60,000 KES which she will use to start another school.

Gladys’s dream is to grow her school into a secondary school in the future.

loans.use: To start another school

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 32 years old, is married to a technician, and has two children. She sells bags and shoes to earn a living and is also employed.

Stella is a member of the Shirley self-help group in Faulu Kenya. With the support of the group members, she has requested a loan of 40,000 KES which she will use to add to her stock of bags and shoes.

Stella hopes to import bags and shoes and to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of bags and shoes

loans.name: Lion Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of Lion group. They are women with small-scale businesses who are based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Isatu S. who is age forty-five and was born in Sanda village. She is married with three children and her husband is a photographer. Her children are attending primary and secondary schools.

For five years now, Isatu has been selling rice and palm-oil. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more rice and palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm-oil in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Tamemsu Rogbaneh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tamemsu Rogbaneh group. They are women with small-scale businesses in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone.

This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and make better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their school fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Marie Father K. (on the left) is the leader of this group. The forty-year-old was born in Makeni. She is married to a painter and they have four children: one is in secondary school, another is in college, and the rest are no longer attending school.

Marie sells groundnuts (peanuts), rice, etc., and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will add more groundnuts and rice to her stock.

loans.use: To add more groundnuts and rice to her stock

loans.name: Seriousness Group

texts.en:
These are women with small-scale businesses in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and make more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, and by feeding and clothing them.

Martha T. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Malal village 48 years ago and is married with six children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending primary school.

Martha sells creams and clothes and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying creams and clothes wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy creams and clothes wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Hold Tight” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Marie K.. Marie is 35 and was born in Matotoka village. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. For five years now, Marie has been selling rubber bowls, dishes, cups, etc. With her share of this loan, she will add more rubber bowls, dishes and cups into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rubber bowls, dishes and cups for her business

loans.name: Sabanoh Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabanoh II” group. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Pa Hassan K. who is pictured in the left. Pa Hassan was born in a village called Konta, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 50 years old and married with five children. Three of the children attend primary school and two secondary school. 

In his small village of Konta, Pa Hassan makes a living by selling pepper and rice. With his many years of experience as a businessman, Pa Hassan will use his share of the loan to buy pepper and rice at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy pepper and rice at wholesale

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es: Claudia Cordelia tiene 56 años de edad, su actividad es una pulpería esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento pues ha sido una muy buena cliente.  Este negocio es su medio de vida para ella, ha sido una persona muy responsable pues disfruta de actividad, al relacionarse con sus clientes.  Es una mujer muy inteligente y ha logrado administrar muy bien su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de gaseosas, granos básicos, jugos, detergentes entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia Cordelia is 56 years old. She runs a grocery store. This is not the first time she will be granted a loan, as she has been a very good client. Her business has been her way of life. She has been a very responsible person and she enjoys her business, especially when dealing with clients. She is a very intelligent woman and she has managed the administration of her business very well. This loan will be used to purchase soft drinks, basic grains, juices, detergents and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miriam Nineth

texts.es: La señora Mirian Nineth C., quien ha trabajo su primer credito kiva, esta muy entusiasmada y motivada por la oportunidad que se le dio, ahora que su negocio a crecido, ha cambiado de ubicación de su negocio,  todo la ayudado bastante, porque con el credito anterior surtio mas su mercaderias, en productos novedosos o la amoda, como los clientes necesitan, ella solicita el presente credito para la compra de ropa para  dama, caballero y niño, ademas de eso estos dias incorporo la venta de bolsos de dama, cosmeticos, ropa de bebe, y accesoriros para el hogar, ve que mientras tenga la oportunidad de invertir es mejor porque sus ventas han aumentado, considera que es un nuevo reto para ella, en brindarles mejor servicio a sus clientes, que a ellos se debe la superacion, crecimiento de su  negocio  y tambien a la ayuda que recibe de Kiva. Con lo que ella esta muy agradecida por el apoyo como mujer micro empresaria.
texts.en:
Mirian Nineth C. has requested a loan from Kiva. She is very happy and motivated by the opportunity that has been granted to her. She will expand her business and she will relocate it. With her past loan she improved the variety of her merchandise, including new and trendy items as requested by her clients. She requests this loan to purchase clothing for men, ladies and children and ladies' hand bags, cosmetics, clothing for babis and household accessories. She will continue to invest because her sales have increased. Her new goal is to provide better service to her clients, especially because it was their support and the support Kiva has provided that has helped her business develop. She is very grateful for the support she receives as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of two.  For the past 32 years, she has been selling clothes. She has one employee in her business. She hopes to improve her standard of living and own property in the future. 

As a member of Faulu Kenya, she had taken out a loan of 20,000 KES. She wants to buy clothes for resale. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 40,000 KES.  Rose dreams of owning a boutique in the future.  Currently, she does not have a permanent business premises but she sees herself owning one in five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson has his membership with Baraka Ukweli group in Faulu Kenya.  He joined the group as an entrepreneur who does welding and metal fabrication and has run the business for two years.  He makes grill doors, windows and metallic chairs.  He gets customers from his neighborhood.  He wants to invest in the business so as to get enough income to build himself a stone house in the future.  Benson’s first loan from Faulu Kenya will be 20,000 KES.  He will use the money to buy metals.

loans.use: To buy metals

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 45 años, reside en San Miguel, tiene una relación libre, vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos de las edades de 14,12 años, se posee un taller de reparación y venta de ruedas nuevas, usadas.
el negocio lo inicio por la necesidad económica y decidió poner un taller el cual tiene 8 años de existir, su esposo le apoya con el trabajo y tiene un empleado. Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ruedas nuevas y usadas de vehículos, esto le permitirá contar con producto que le demandan los clientes, contribuir a mejorar las condiciones económicas, generar más ingresos a base del trabajo.
Las aspiraciones son comprar una vivienda propia, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios que estos terminen una carrera universitaria que tengan una propia oficina.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives in San Miguel. She’s in a free union with her life partner and they have two children who are 14 and 12 years of age. She has a new and used car tire repair and sales business. She opened the shop due to economic need and it’s been in operation for 8 years now. Her husband helps her with the work and she has one employee. She is asking for funds to buy new and used vehicle tires which will allow her to have stock available to meet customer demand, to contribute to improve economic conditions and generate more work-based income. Her aspirations are to buy her own house and to support her children’s schooling so that they finish a university career and have their own office.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new and used car tires.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es madre soltera, tiene un hija de ocho años, la cual depende de los ingresos del negocio, Rosa de dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortilla de maíz.
El negocio es herencia de la abuela y la madre tiene 13 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas, tiene clientes y hasta la fecha es un producto de gran demanda. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para compra de materiales para mejorar la vivienda, techo, paredes, puertas. El financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, y evitar riegos a la familia.
Las aspiraciones son apoyar a la hija con los estudios que le permitan encontrar un trabajo a futuro ella le gustaría trabajar con dinero propio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 38, lives in San Miguel. She’s a single mother of an 8-year-old daughter who depends on the business’ income. Rosa makes and sells corn tortillas. The business was inherited from her grandmother and mother. She’s been in the tortilla making business for 13 years which to date is a highly sought after product. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements: roof, walls, doors. The financing will help her improve her home’s conditions and prevent risks for the family. Her dream is to support her daughter’s education so that she can get a good job. In the future she’d like to work with her own money.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvements: roof, walls, doors.

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana tiene 31 años D. edad resiD. en San Miguel, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos D. las edades D. 7 y 4 años, los cuales dependen económicamente D. ella, ella posee un negocio D. elaboración D. tortilla y pupusas. 
El negocio lo inicio por la necesidad D. ingresos que le permitieran apoyar la familia, ella solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. pupusas como Son harina D. Maíz, aceite, queso, carne D. cerdo, entre otros. Esto le permitirá incrementar las ventas, generar más ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas D. la familia.
Los sueños son contar con el dinero para comprar su propia vivienda y dar le a los hijos un mejor sistema D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and she lives in San Miguel. She is married and she lives together with her husband and their two children, aged 7 and 4 years old, and they depend on her. She has a tortilla and pupusa business. She started this business following their need for a source of income to support the family. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make pupusas, such as corn flour, cooking oil, cheese, pork meat etc. This will allow her to increase her sales and generate more income to cover the basic needs of the family. Her dreams are to have enough money to buy her own home and to proviD. her kids with a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, cooking oil, cheese, pork etc.

loans.name: Lesver Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Lesver Suncín es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se graduó como médico general y actualmente estudia la especialidad en Pediatría la cual está por culminar, se desempeña como tal en el Hospital Alemán Nicaragüense donde tiene cinco años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel el cual lo requiere para realizar su monografía, pago de matrícula, memoria y aseso metodológico con el objetivo de obtener su título como pediatra.
texts.en:
Lesver Suncín is from the municipality of El Sauce. He is a university graduate with a general degree in Medicine and currently is finishing up his studies in Pediatrics. He is employed as such at the Hospital Alemán Nicaragüense [Nicaraguan German Hospital] where he has worked for five years. This is his first loan with Ceprodel which he requires in order to cover costs for his dissertation, enrollment fees, written report and a methodology advisor for obtaining his qualifications as a pediatrician.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover costs for enrollment, dissertation, written report and methodology advisor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, and gravel

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
GRUPO  JUNTAS PODEMOS
 El grupo está conformado  por  tres  hermanas que se dedican a la venta de verduras en el mercado local  de San Juan Sacatepéquez ,   ANGELICA  R. G. se dedica a la venta de condimentos para  comida( venta de especies),  inicio con su negocio hace 20 años vendiendo  como  ambulante  en  los diferentes pueblos que eran más cercanas  a la aldea  y los días domingos vendía fuera del mercado  durante 15 años  luego  tuvo la oportunidad  de poder comprar un puesto  dentro del mercado  desde hace  5 años  donde  ya tiene clientes fijos  que  le compran   su mercadería, tiene  3  hijos uno de ellos estudia y trabaja  los otros estudian   la señora no vive con su esposo ella ha sacado a sus hijos adelante con la ayuda de su negocio   su mayor deseo  es agrandar su puesto para poder tener más variedad en  ingredientes  para comida ( especies ), MARIA R. G.   se dedica a   la venta de verdura  en el mercado local de San Juan, tiene 3 hijos  uno de ellos ya es  mayor de edad, su esposo le ayuda   a vender cuando esta de descanso su mayor deseo es tener un segundo puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus verduras . ANA ALICIA R. G. se dedica a la venta de verdura   y de algunos granos básicos  para el consumo diario  su puesto se encuentra también en el mercado local, tiene una hija  menor de edad y  su deseó para su negocio es tener más variedad de verduras  como también poder darle un mejor futuro con lo necesario para su hija.
texts.en:
Group name: Together We Can The group is made up of three sisters. They sell vegetables in the local market of San Juan Sacatepequez. Angelica R. G. sells condiments (spices). She started her business 20 years ago, selling door to door in the villages closest to their town and on Sundays she sold outside the market for the past 15 years. She found the opportunity to purchase a stand inside the market five years ago and now she has a steady client base to purchase her merchandise. She has 3 children, one is working and the others are in school. She is no longer together with her husband; she raised the kids herself with the help of her business. Her greatest dream is to have a larger stand from where to display a greater variety of ingredients and spices for sale. Maria R. G. sells vegetables in the local market of San Juan. She has 3 children, one is independent. Her husband helps her with her business in his spare time. Her greatest dream is to have a second stand from where to sell vegetables. Ana Alicia R. G. sells vegetables and basic grains of every day use. Her stand is also located in the local market. She has a young daughter. Her dream is to have more variety in the products she sells and to provide a better future for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro S. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Inspector de sanidad para el Centro de Salud de dicho municipio donde tiene 28 años de laborar para dicha Institución tiene un año de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado dos créditos uno para mejora en su vivienda y el otro para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para consumo con el fin de resolver necesidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Pedro S. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. He works as a health inspector for the Health Center of the municipality, the institution where he has been working for 28 years. He has worked with CEPRODEL for one year, where they have granted him two loans – one for housing improvements and the other for personal expenses. This loan that he has requested is for the purpose of paying for home needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal consumption

loans.name: Yury Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Yury es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Responsable de agua y saneamiento en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene ocho años de laborar. Tiene tres años de laborar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos, el crédito lo solicitó para la compra de bloques, hierros, alambre de amarre, con el fin de empezar a construir su vivienda para brindarles un bienestar mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yury is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. He is the Head of Water and Sanitation for the Municipality of El Sauce, where he has worked for 8 years. He has worked with CEPRODEL for 3 years, where he has taken 3 loans. The loan that he requests will be used to purchase cement blocks, iron and bales of wire. He will use these materials to begin to build a house to provide for the well-being of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, iron, bales of wire, and cement

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 63 años de edad, ella reside en San Miguel, vive con el compañero de vida y tiene un hijo el cual ya no depende económicamente de ella, ella se dedica a la fabricación de ropa y venta de sandalias, (zapato para dama). 
Dolores es costurera hace uniforme escolares trabaja con un proyecto nacional y también elabora ropa a personas particulares, el horario regular de trabajo es de 8:00am-7:00pm, ella estudio en una academia de costura para aprender a fabricar ropa. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como son telas, hilo de seda de diferentes colores, también ella le gustaría invertir en la compra de sandalias para vender, esto le ayudara a incrementar las ventas mejorar los ingresos, mejorar la condiciones de vida de la familia.
Ella tiene como propósito manejar su propio dinero para no tener dependencia financiera.
texts.en:
Dolores is 63 years old and she lives in the town of San Miguel. She lives with her life partner and they have a son but he no longer depends on her financially. She makes clothing and she sells sandals (ladies' shoes). Dolores is a seamstress. She makes school uniforms for schools across the country. She also makes casual style clothing. Her regular schedule is from 8am to 7pm. She attended a tailoring academy to learn her trade. She requests a loan to purchase work materials such as fabrics, silk threads in different colors, and she would also like to invest in the purchase of sandals for resale. This will all help her increase her sales and her income. It will permit her to improve her family's living conditions. Her goal is to manage her finances so that she will no longer have to be dependent.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as fabrics, silk threads in different colors, and ladies' shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es: La Sra. Blandón es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña en el cargo de cocina en el Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Agropecuaria de dicho municipio donde tiene cuatro años de laborar para dicho centro. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cinco créditos consecutivos para gastos de su hogar. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de una refrigeradora y un televisor con el objetivo de amueblar su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blandón is from the municipality "El Sauce." She is a cook in the school "Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Agropecuaria" which is located in the same municipality. She has been doing this job for four years. She has also worked with Ceprodel for four years, where she has been given five consecutive loans for household expenses. She is taking out this loan to buy a refridgerator and a television in order to furnish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To a refridgerator and a television.

loans.name: Víctor Leonel

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor Leonel B. M.   él  es Trabajadora activo  de la Empresa servicios Múltiples desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad, tiene  treinta años de trabajar para esta empresa, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Leonel B. M. is an active employee of "Empresa Servicios Múltiples" where he works as a security guard. He has worked for this business for thirty years, since he was school-age. He has had two loans with "CEPRODEL" and he has taken out these loans to buy construction matrials to improve his home. They have helped him a great deal because he has been able to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials: quarry stones, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario San Isidro Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo  San Isidro, está conformado por 4 miembros originarias de este municipio,, solicitan su segundo crédito Kiva, cuentan con  dos integrantes nuevas, 3 de ellas se dedican a la confección y venta de delantales que ellas elaboran en su casa han logrado compra su propia maquina , este negocio les parece rentable ya que los delantales son muy utilizados por las mujeres indígenas de nuestro país. Y una a la siembra y cultivo de flores, ella requiere de capital para invertir desde ya para la fiesta o tradición de adornar el primero de noviembre conocido como  el día a los difuntos, el grupo es representado por  la señora Mirian Leticia C., quien es unida y tiene  3 hijos, ella confecciona  delantales  hace varios años, por lo que la gente ya la conocen esto le ayuda mucho  porque la gente llega a su domicilio a comprar, o a realizar sus pedidos, manifiestan que son muy positivas con este nuevo crédito sea de mucho beneficio  como el anterior.
texts.en:
The group named San Isidro is made up of 4 members, all originally from the same municipality. They request a second loan from Kiva. They have two new members. Three of the members make aprons in the homes and later sell them. They have managed to purchase their own sewing machines. This business has been successful because the aprons are widely used by the indigenous women of the country. Another one of the members grows flowers. She requires working capital to prepare for the Day of the Dead celebrated on November first, when it is tradition to have everything decorated. The group is represented by Mrs. Mirian Leticia C.. She is married and she has 3 children. She has been making aprons for many years. Her clients know her well and it helps because her customers come to her house to purchase the goods, or to place orders. The members of the group indicate that they are very optimistic about this loan because it will be of great benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials: quarry stone, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Luis
texts.en: Mr. José Luis

loans.use: To buy a steer.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. José Francisco C. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como conserje en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene años de laborar. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Cepordel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de medicina para la buena salud de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. José Francisco C. is from the town of El Sauce. He is currently employed by the city as a caretaker; he’s been thus employed for years. He has collaborated with Ceprodel for two years and has had three loans for personal expenses. This loan was requested to buy medicine for his wife’s good health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Martha Ofelia

texts.es: La  Sra. Martha Ofelia R. C.   ella  es Trabajadora del colegio público “Rodolfo Schear” de San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte y siete año de trabajar para el magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene una niña en Edad escolar y cuatro hijos en la universidad. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de una computadora para el uso de sus hijos, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel  le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Ofelia R. C. is an employee of the public school, Rodolfo Schear, in San Rafael del Sur. She works as an elementary school teacher and has been working in teaching for 27 years. She is currently married and has a school-aged daughter and four children in college. She has had seven loans with CEPRODEL and she has used them to purchase construction materials to improve the house in which she lives. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a computer for her children to use. Her loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her in a great way since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: La señora Juana Paula E. se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur donde a diario las ofrece en diversos lugares buscando la manera de suplir las necesidades de su hogar. Ella tiene  cuatro  años de dedicarse a esta actividad y tiene un niño en edad escolar. El crédito que está solicitando será invertido directamente en la compra de las joyas de plata porque ya se le han agotado y necesita volver a llenar sus estantes para así continuar obteniendo los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana Paula E. S. works providing moto taxi services as her main job. The moto taxis are driver by her two children who also work repairing them and keeping them maintained. At the same time, she works selling silver jewelry. She has been working in these businesses for four years and has a school-aged son. She has received eleven loans through CEPRODEL and she has used them to improve her jewelry business and to provide maintenance to her moto taxis. The loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her in a great way since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de joyas de plata para la venta

loans.name: Clemencia Lucia

texts.es:
Clemente de 46 años, tiene un taller de confección en su casa y vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Ella comenzó con su negocio ya que se separo de su esposo y se quedo con sus tres hijos, conforme pasaron los años ella fue incrementando su clientela, hasta ahora que ya todos sus hijos se independizaron y ella y tiene un taller de confección en su casa. Ella hace camisas, pantalones, blusas desde muy temprano en la mañana. 

Para seguir produciendo ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina de coser. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Clemencia is 46 years old. She has a tailoring shop set up in her home. She lives in the suburban region named Paraiso, known for its unpaved roads and mountains. She started her business when she separated from her husband and she was left to raise her three children. With the passage of time her clientele started to grow. Her kids are now grown up and independent. But her business continues and she makes men's shirts, slacks, and ladies' blouses from very early in the morning. She requests a loan to keep up her business and to purchase a sewing machine. In the future she would like to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nery Del Socorro

texts.es: La  Sra. Nery del Socorro A. S.   ella  es Trabajadora del colegio público “Emmanuel Mongalo y Rubio S. Norte” de San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte año de trabajar para el magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en Edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la reparación del techo de su cocina y levantado de muro de la misma, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Nery del Socorro A. S. is an employee of the public school, Emmanuel Mongalo y Rubio S. Norte, in San Rafael del Sur. She works as an elemenary school teacher and has worked in teaching for 21 years. She is currently married and has a school-aged son. She has had seven loans with CEPRODEL and she has used them to purchase construction materials to improve the house in which she lives. She is requesting this loan to repair the roof of her kitchen and raising the wall as well. The loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her in a great way since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: quarry stone, cement, zinc sheets, beams, etc.

loans.name: Wendy De Fátima

texts.es: La Sra. Wendy de Fátima A. H.   ella  se desempeña  como Maestra de Educación Secundaria, tiene  tres años de trabajar como docente, tiene un niño en edad escolar, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wendy de Fátima A. has been employed as a secondary school teacher for three years. She is married and has a school aged son. She has had four loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies to make some home improvements. Ceprodel loans have been of great use to her in that they have made it possible for her to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies: paving stones, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Raquel U. G. es trabajadora activa del Centro de Salud “San Rafael del Sur”   ella  se desempeña  como Secretaria Ejecutiva, tiene  dieciocho años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para cambio de techo de unos de los curtos de su casa, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel U. G. works at the San Rafael del Sur Health Center as an executive secretary. She has worked there for eighteen years. She is currently married. She has had twelve loans from CEPRODEL, which she has used to purchase construction materials to improve her house. She is asking for this loan to replace the ceiling in one of the rooms in her house. Her loans from Ceprodel have benefited her, and she has been able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to replace a ceiling

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es: La Sra. Yojana P. es trabajadora activa del Centro de Salud “San Rafael del Sur”   ella  se desempeña  como Secretaria Ejecutiva, tiene  diecisiete años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para aumentarle un cuartos más  a su casa,  los cuales  los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yojana P. works at the San Rafael del Sur Health Center as an executive secretary. She has worked there for seventeen years, and is married. She has received nine loans from CEPRODEL, and has used them to purchase construction materials to improve her house. She is asking for this loan to improve another room in her house. The loans from Ceprodel have benefited her very much, and she has used them to improve the quality of life of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: Stone, sand, cement, etc

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Las Alamedas Group

texts.es:
HISTORIA DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO  LA ALAMEDA



MARLENA T. V.. Es originaria de Momostenango, Totonicapán  pero actualmente vive en Chimaltenango en la alameda, ella tiene treinta u tres años de edad
Tiene dos hijas y están estudiando en la escuela nacional  de la alameda, ella se vino a vivir a Chimaltenango porque en su pueblo ya no había negocio ella se dedica a vender ropa típica y también cosméticos su negocio lo tiene en su casa y también vende ambulante, estuvo trabajando con otra organización pero la organización les fallo y por esa razón  se retiraron de ese grupo.
VIDALIA U. A.. Es originaria de chimaltenango tiene 58 años  se dedica a la venta de leña tiene 5 años de tener ese negocio la señora tiene 13 hijos pero actualmente solo mantiene a tres porque el resto ya se caso, su esposo la apoya en su negocio porque a veces le llevan bastante leña y ella no puede hacer sola su negocio, también tiene el apoyo de sus hijos.
MONICA ORFELINA T. V.. Ella también es originaria de momostenango
Actualmente vive en chimaltenango, se avecindaron en este departamento porque en su
Municipio ya no había negocio, ella se dedica a elaborar ropa de bebe en tricot, lleva cuatro años de experiencia en su negocio, ella también trabaja en el hospital de antigua
Y es allí donde aprovecha a ofrecer su producto.
CATALINA L. A.. Ella es originaria de Sn Martin Jilotepeque, estuvo viviendo mucho tiempo en comalapa trabajo en el bco. Trabajadoras comalapenses por muchos años después que se traslado a chimaltenango ya no pudo integrarse en el grupo y es por eso que actualmente supo de mi área de trabajo se comunico para pode integrarla en un grupo fue muy buena socia en el Bco. Ella dice que gracias a Dios su negocio le ha ayudado a sobresalir, construyo su casa en la colonia la alameda de chimaltenango, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario desde hace muchos años
texts.en:
History of the group named "La Alameda" Marlena T. V. is originally from Momostenango in Totonicapan but she now lives in Chimaltenango in La Alameda. She is thirty three years old. She has two daughters who are currently attending public school in La Alameda. She came to live to Chimaltenango because in her village there was no business. She sells traditional clothing and cosmetics. Her business is run from her home but she also sells door to door. She once belonged to a different group but they were not successful so she joined this group instead. Vidalia U. A. is originally from Chimaltenango. She is 58 years old and she sells firewood. She has been running this business for the past 5 years. She has 13 children but only three of them are still dependent on her. The others are married. Her husband helps her with her business. Sometimes she receives a large quantity of firewood and she can't manage it on her own. Her kids also provide her with their support. Monica Orfelina T. V. is originally from Momostenango but she now lives in Chimaltenango. She came to this region because in their village there was no business. She knits baby clothes. She has four years' experience in the business. She also works in the Antigua hospital and it is there where she sells most of her products. Catalina L. A. is originally from Jilotepeque. She lived a long time in Comalapa and was part of the group named "Comalapa's Workers" but she had to leave the group when she moved to Chimaltenango. She got to know the new area and she joined this group, having had good references from the previous one. She says, Thanks to God her business has helped her survive. She built a house in the colony of La Alameda in Chimaltenango. She sells general products of every day use.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jorge Dante

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 21 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el anexo San Ramón del caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, una zona rural que forma parte del distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace dos años. El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí, el ofrece a sus clientes productos de consumo diario a los cuales no tienen fácil acceso debido a que la zona se encuentra lejos del pueblo central. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida y gracias a los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad sustenta los gastos de su familia.

Jorge desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jorge es un padre trabajador y muy entregado a su familia. Diariamente da lo mejor de si para sacarlos adelante y brindarles la calidad de vida que necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a family man. He is 21 years old and he lives together with his wife and their young son in the region of San Ramon in Caserio Fanupe, Barrio Nuevo. The region is a rural zone that is part of the district of Morrope in the province of Lambayeque. Region is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has had his grocery store for two years. He has set up a small store in a section of his house. There he sells products of every day use to his clients, who do not have easy access to such products from the main village for its far distance. The business is successful and it is thanks to this source of income that he is able to cover the family's expenses. Jorge wishes to expand his business and to purchase more merchandise, to increase his sales and see an improvement in his earnings. He does not have enough capital funds to make this happen on his own. He requests a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. Jorge is a hard working and very devoted father. Every day he gives his all to provide his family with the quality of life they need. People know him for being calm and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory to restock his grocery store.

loans.name: Leh We Believe Weself Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Aminata T.. Aminata who is 40 was born in Makeni city. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. One of the children is in primary school and two are secondary school.  

For 15 years now, Aminata has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloths, sometimes with fabricated designs). With her share of this loan, Aminata is going to expand her business by buying gara lapper making materials including inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc in order to produce more gara cloths to sell.

loans.use: Buy gara lapper making materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his house: purchasing corrugated metal roofing sheets, wood and beams

loans.name: Sobbeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOBBEYA est créé  il y a de cela plus de 9 ans. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du banc villageois de KADIOR.

Madame Aminata S.,debout tout à fait à gauche de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de bois de chauffe et d'huile de palme. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages pour venir revendre dans la ville de Ziguinchor. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir mener depuis plus de 5 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandise (bois de chauffe et huile de palme) afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus importants.

Son objectif est d'augmenter ses revenus financiers afin de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Solidarity group SOBBEYA was set up over 9 years ago. The group is made up of 11 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They have come together as friends and neighbors. The solidarity group is a part of the Kadior "banc villageois." Mrs. Aminata S., standing on the left of the photo, is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She has begun a small business selling firewood and palm oil. She gets her supplies in the villages and re-sells them in the town of Ziguinchor. She is quite experienced in this activity, which she has carried out for more than 5 years. With the new loan, she can increase her stock of merchandise (firewood and palm oil) so as to make more profit. Her goal is to increase her revenue so that she can better meet her family's daily needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and palm oil

loans.name: Na We Cam Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Na We Cam” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ramatu K. who is pictured on the left. Ramatu was born in a place called Sanda near Makeni. The 45-year-old is married and has eight children, one of whom is attending secondary school.  

Ramatu sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) and has been doing this business for a very long time. Ramatu is seeking this loan in order to expand her business. She will buy gara lapper making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder and white cotton cloths. In this way, she will be able to produce a large number of cloths to sell.

loans.use: To buy gara lapper making materials

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Association Group

texts.en: Kadiatu T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Makeni city, about 44 years ago. She is married with two children, both of whom are attending secondary school. Kadiatu sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. She has been running this business for countless years. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,400,000) to expand her business. She will buy rice and palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm oil

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en: Presented to you here are members of the “Development” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni who are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group in order to expand their businesses. Abdulai T. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. He is 42 years old and was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Abdulai is married and has one child who attends primary school. For 10 years now, Abdulai has been selling palm oil, groundnut/peanuts, charcoal, etc. With his share of this loan, he will invest in his business by buying gallons of palm oil, groundnuts and charcoal to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, groundnuts and charcoal to add to his current stock

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. Ella tiene una gabinete de belleza en una parte de su casa. 

Ella trabajaba en una guardería y con los ingresos que ganaba hizo cursos de peinados y belleza. Poco a poco ahorrando dinero y practicando pudo comprar algunos productos de belleza y maquinas como panchas, secadoras, después de un tiempo readecuo su casa para tener su propio salón de belleza. 

Ahora ella quiere comprar con el préstamo productos de belleza y un lavadero de cabello. En el futuro quiere terminar sus estudios de belleza y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old and she lives in the suburban region of Paraiso, known for its unpaved roads and mountains. She has remodelled a section of her house to be a beauty shop. She once worked in a day care and with those earnings she went to beauty school. Slowly she saved enough money and gained some practice to purchase some beauty products and appliances, such as curling irons and hair dryers. She launched her business and set up her own beauty salon. She requests a loan to purchase beauty products and a hair washing station. In the future she hopes to finish her beauty school training and build a better house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and a hair washing station.

loans.name: Boris Stalin

texts.es: El Sr. Boris Stalin G. T. el es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Responsable de turismo social tiene  dos  años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casado actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada préstamo lo  ha realizado para diferentes actividades, gastos médicos, mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de granos como trigo, maíz, para siembra y fertilizantes, los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Boris Stalin G. T. is employed by the city of San Rafael del Sur; he’s Chief of the Social Tourism department. He has been thus employed for two years. He’s married and has a school age son. He has had seven loans with CEPRODEL each of which has been used for different purposes: medical expenses, home improvements. They have been of great benefit to him in that they have improved his and his family’s living condition. The current requested loan will be used to buy grains like wheat and corn to plant and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Aposentos Group

texts.es:
HISTORIA GRUPO SOLIDARIO LOS APOSENTOS


GLORIA Q. H.. Es originaria de Chimaltenango tiene 42 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo, tiene su puesto en el mercado de chimaltenango, pero también vende por mayor en su casa, ella tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pollo, trabajaba también en otra organización con crédito pero ella cuenta que cuando mas necesitaba el dinero la institución se lo negó y por esa razón se retiro de este grupo
IRIS DEL ROSARIO PIRIR USEN. Ella tiene venta de productos de consumo diario ella es soltera su negocio lo tiene en su casa en la Alameda chimaltenango, ella dice que sus ventas son buenas porque por donde ella vive hay muy pocas tiendas y a veces lo que la gente necesita no lo encuentra en las otra tiendas, ya tiene sus clientes y que gracias a la confianza que le tienen siempre ha mantenido venta.

LUZ ADELAIDA P. Q.. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de paca, tiene 19 años, además de su negocio tiene un trabajo en una fabrica por lo que ella cuenta que después de trabajar habré su negocio porque su trabajo no es de diario, y esto le ayuda a obtener otros ingresos porque hay días en que hay muy poca venta.
texts.en:
History of the group named Los Aposentos Gloria Q. H. is originally from Chimaltenango. She is 42 years old and she sells chicken. She has as stand in the market in Chimaltenango but she also sells in wholesale from her house. She has raised and sold chickens for the past 8 years. She also worked in another organization but they let her down when she most needed the help so she left that group. Iris Del Rosario Pirir Usen sells grocery store items. She is single and she runs her business from a section in her house located in La Alameda in Chimaltenango. She says that her sales are good especially because there are only a few stores and clients often don't find what they need in the other stores. She has a steady client base and this has helped her establish solid sales. Luz Adelaida P. Q. sells Paca clothing. She is 19 years old. She also works in a company but after work she opens her business. Her paid work is not full time so her business helps her have another source of income. There are days when there are very few sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Venicia Dionisia

texts.es: La señora Venicia V. labora en una institución siendo una persona muy responsable y aplicada en su trabajo que a diario realiza. Ella es soltera y con un hijo que depende de ella por lo que tiene que esforzarse más para suplir las necesidades de este pequeño. Hoy en día está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos para su hogar debido a que los que ha tenido ya están deteriorandose y ella necesita mejorarlos para así mejorar su condición y suplir todas las necesidades de su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Venecia Dionisia works for UNICA as a custodian who cleans at the University. She is single and has a son who depends on her. She has received two loans from CEPRODEL, and appreciates their support since she has been able to get ahead and earn additional income. Her first loan was used to plant a corn crop, which she sold and then earned additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an electrical appliance for home

loans.name: Lenin Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr. Lenin Antonio M. G.    él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Inspector Ambiental tiene  dos año de trabajar para esta empresa es casado actualmente, tiene 2 niños en Edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Lenin Antonio M. G. works for the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, in the position of Environmental Inspector. He has worked for this organization for two years. He is married and has 2 children of school age. He has had six loans with CEPRODEL, which he has used to buy construction materials to improve the home where he lives. The loans have benefited him greatly, because they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, stones and cement

loans.name: Sandra Petrona

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra Petrona G. V.  ella  es Trabajadora activa  del colegio público san Cayetano desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación secundaria, tiene  diez años de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Petrona G. V. works for the public school "San Cayetano" as a secondary school teacher. She has worked for this school for 10 years. She has taken 4 loans with CEPRODEL, which she has used to buy construction materials to improve her home. This has benefited her a lot, since in this way she has improved the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement and stone

loans.name: Emérita Yovanela

texts.es: La  Sra. Emérita Yovanela R. C.  ella  es trabajadora del colegio público “CERMA” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria , tiene  veinte ocho  años de desempeñarse como Docente, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  seis  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de el y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emérita Yovanela R. C. has been a teacher for 28 years; she’s currently employed as a primary school teacher at “CERMA” public school. She’s married. She has had six loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to her in that they have helped to improve her and her family’s living conditions. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For zinc metal sheeting, sand and cement.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Luz Marina A. S.   ella  es Trabajadora activo  del colegio público “CERMA” de San Rafael Del Sur  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria, tiene  treinta y un años de trabajar para esta empresa,. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina A. S. is an active worker at the “CERMA” public school in San Rafael Del Sur, in the position of elementary school teacher. She has worked for this organization for thirty-one years. She has had twelve loans with CEPRODEL, which she has used to buy construction materials to improve the home where she lives. The loans have benefited her greatly, because they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stones, sand and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying metal sheets to repair his roof

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga M. Díaz   ella  es Trabajadora activo  del colegio público “Instituto Nacional de San Rafael Del Sur”  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Secundaria, tiene  veinte y cuatro  años de trabajar para esta empresa,. Ha tenido  dieciocho créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la reparación de su baño,  los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
