Ana dice que gracias a los prestamos otorgados por ceprodel a hora cuenta con dos corredores que le entrega lotería.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana A. sells lottery tickets at the Israel Lewite Market as a street vendor. She works from 9am until 5pm. Ana is a single mother with a daughter who is attending the university.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for nine loan cycles and used the proceeds to invest in her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy lottery tickets, “Chalupa” bingo games, and scratch cards. Ana says she is grateful for the loans CEPRODEL has provided because she is able to work with two brokers who administer the lottery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets, bingo games, and scratch cards

loans.name: Yeral José

texts.es: El Sr. Yeral José P. él es Trabajador de la Empresa Electric Man Power desempeñándose como Técnico auxiliar tiene dos  años de trabajar para esta Institución, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL uno lo  realizo para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de repuestos mecánico de un vehículo los cuales los créditos con ceprodel  le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Yeral José P. is an employee of the Electric Man Power Company and has worked the past two years as an assistant technician. He has a child who is of school age. Yeral has had two loans with CEPRODEL, one of which was used to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

He is now requesting a loan in order to buy mechanical parts for his vehicle. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit because they have allowed him to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Mariella

texts.es:
Mariella tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su madre en el anexo Huaca Blanca del distrito de Chongoyape, un distrito agrícola situado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de salir adelante y mantener a su menor hijo hizo que instalara en su vivienda una bodega – bazar en donde ofrece a sus clientes artículos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y prendas de vestir. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad se ha hecho conocida y ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su negocio a adquirir los productos que ofrece.

Ella se esfuerza diariamente para mantenerse en el negocio y sacarlo adelante ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos. Actualmente desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo una mayor cantidad de abarrotes. Esta inversión le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y por ende, sus ganancias, para lograr este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Mariella es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de disfrutar de un futuro estable y próspero. Las persona que le conocen la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Mariella, 33, is a single mother of one son. She lives with her mother in Huaca Blanca Annex, Chongoyape district, an agricultural district located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get ahead and support her minor son motivated her to set up a general store in her home where she stocks groceries, basic needs items and clothes. Thanks to the length of time she’s been working she has become quite well known and she has a group of regular customers that come by her store to get what they need. She struggles daily to stay in business and have it succeed because it’s her only source of income. She wants to expand her store acquiring a larger amount of groceries. This will allow for higher sales and thus profits. To reach this goal she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan. Mariella is an enterprising, tenacious woman. Her greatest wish is to offer her son the opportunity to enjoy a stable and prosperous future. People who know her consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es: La  Sra. María de los Santos G. M.   ella  es Trabajadora del colegio público “Los Muñoz” la ceiba Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte y un año de trabajar para el magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene tres niño en Edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de un electrodoméstico “Refrigeradora”, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. María de los Santos G. M. is an employee of Los Muñoz Public School in La Ceiba Villa El Carmen. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 21 years. María is married and has three school age children. She has taken five loans with CEPRODEL which were used to buy construction materials for making improvements to her home.

María is requesting a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit because they have helped her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma del Carmen V. Pérez tiene  su negocio en el mercado Israel lewite de venta de repostería, gaseosa, jugos y queque.
Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, ella trabaja sola y se encarga de la administración del negocio y de la atención de la clientela.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería como; repostería, gaseosas, jugos y pasteles.
Ha trabajado con ceprodel cuatro créditos y estos han sido todos para inversión de su negocio.
Dice que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel a hora cuenta con más cliente y su negocio esta más abastecido y a hora puede competir con la competencia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma del Carmen V. Pérez has her business in the Israel Lewite Market; she sells pastry, soft-drinks, juices and cake. She is open for business Monday through Saturday from 9am until 5pm. She works alone and both runs the business and tends to customers herself. The loan is requested to buy merchandise like: pastries, soft-drinks, juices and cakes. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for four loans that have been invested in her business. She says that thanks to the loans from Ceprodel she now has more customers and the business is better stocked so that now she can face her competition better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pastry, soft-drinks, juice and cake sales.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. María Eugenia V. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene ocho años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el fin de mejorar su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
María Eugenia V. is from the municipality of El Sauce. She works as a primary school teacher at the Simeón Pereira School, in the same municpality. She has worked there for eight years. This is the first loan she is requesting from CEPRODEL, with the aim of improving her home. The loan will be invested in buying cement and sand, and paying for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cement and sand, and paying for labor

loans.name: José Fanor

texts.es: El Sr. José Fanor H. M. es trabajador activo del Ministerio de la Familia “San Rafael del Sur”   el  se desempeña  como Atención Familiar, tiene  veinte y un año de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para cambio de techo de unos de los curtos de su casa, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Fanor H. M. has been employed by the “San Rafael del Sur” Family Ministry for 21 years in the Attention to Families department. He is married and has a school aged child. He has had 6 loans with CEPRODEL that have been used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. This loan is requested for building materials and supplies to replace the roof on some of the rooms of the house. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to replace the roof: zinc metal sheeting and tubing, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Elías Alberto

texts.es: El  Sr. Elías Alberto H. B.  él  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene  veinte años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales para la siembra de granos como maíz, sorgo, etc.  Los cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Elías Alberto H. B. is a farmer. He’s been in this line of work for 20 years. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL that have been used to buy farming supplies for planting corn and sorghum, etc. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies like urea and to finish plowing the fields.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: El  Sr. Manuel de Jesús H. H.  él  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene  cuarenta y cinco años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales para la siembra de granos como maíz, sorgo, etc.  Los cuales  los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús H. H. works in agriculture. He has dedicated himself to this activity for 45 years. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used them to buy supplies for planting grains such as corn, sorghum, etc. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him greatly, because they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for planting: urea, balanced fertilizer, a field plow

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
El clienta Marta M.. Vive en la Comarca las Pilas del municipio el sauce departamento león, tiene 3 hijo a su cargo se dedica principal mente a la actividad compra y venta de cerdo para el destace y además de esta actividad tiene un negocio de verduras en la zona. 
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia, donde la desarrolla para la explotación de su negocio.
 
El destino del crédito fue para la compra de credos destinado para el destace y compra de verduras. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su familia y aumentar las sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Marta M. lives in the Pilas area of the municipality of El Sauce in the department of León. She has 3 children under her care and her main job is buying and selling pigs to butcher. In addition, she also has a vegetable business in the area. She has her own house from which she operates her business.

The loan will be used for the purchase of pigs for butchering and for the purchase of vegetables.

This will allow her to keep her family in better conditions and increase her monthly earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of pigs and vegetables

loans.name: Erika Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Erika Juana V. H. ella  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene  ocho años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casada actualmente, tiene 2 niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales para la siembra de granos como maíz, trigo, etc.  Los cuales  los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia
texts.en:
Erika Juana V. H. works in agriculture and has been in the business for eight years. She is currently married and has two school-aged children. She has had two loans through CEPRODEL and she has used them to purchase materials for planting grains such as corn, wheat, etc. The loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her in a great way since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for planting: urea, plow

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Azucena A. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene 25 años de laborar. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos para mejora de vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de zinc y medicamento.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena A. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as an elementary school teacher in the Simeón Pereira school in El Sauce, where she has worked for 25 years. She has been working with CEPRODEL for four years and they have granted her four loans for housing improvements. The loan requested is for the purchase of zinc and medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc, and to purchase medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and sale of pants and shirts

loans.name: Zela Yamileth

texts.es: La Sra. Zela Yamileth H.   ella se desempeña  como coordinadora técnica en la delegación del MINED, tiene  dieciocho años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente, tiene dos niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción y medicamentos para un familiar enfermo, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Zela Yamileth H. works as technical coordinator at the delegation of MINED (Ministry of Education) and has being working for the institution for eighteen years. She is currently married and has two school-aged children. She has had six loans through CEPRODEL and she has used them to purchase construction materials to make housing improvements. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of construction materials and medicine for a sick family member. The loans with CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to her since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for a new roof: zinc, beams, sand, cement, and the purchase of agricultural products

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío La Pilca del distrito de Olmos, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a que pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario por los cualen tendrian que dirigirse hacia el pueblo central, que se encuentra muy alejado.

Con el dinero que percibe de este negocio ella ayuda a su esposo a solventar la economía familiar. Diariamente Eugenia se esfuerza por brindar a sus clientes la mejor atención, con esto ella mantiene una clientela estable. Actualmente ella desea adquirir mas mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar su nivel de ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Eugenia es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona de confianza
texts.en:
Eugenia is a 49 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of La Pilca, in the Olmos district, an agricultural district in the Lambayeque province, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She sells staples and groceries from a grocery store located in her own home. The business is well received as it provides clients with a range of basic products that would otherwise require a trip to the main village, which is a long way away. With the money she gets from her business she helps her husband support the family finances. Every day Eugenia strives to provide her customers with the best care, which helps her maintain a stable client base. Now she whould like to buy more merchandise to meet customer demand and increase her sales. To achieve her goal she has requested a loan for 1,500 soles to Edpyme Alternativa. Eugenia is a responsible and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur and give her family a better quality of life. In her neighbourhood those who know her consider her a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to extend grocery store located in owner's home.

loans.name: Rafael Ángel

texts.es: El Sr. Rafael Ángel Z. H.   él  se desempeña  como guarda de seguridad en la empresa WACKENHUT , tiene  siete años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente, tiene tres niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de zinc, perlines y comprar urea, completo para sembrar porque aparte de ser trabajador para la empresa él se dedica a la siembra de granos, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael Ángel Z. H. has been employed by WACKENHUT (a Security Services firm) as a Security Guard for the last 7 years. He is married and has three school age children. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL that he’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. This loan is to buy zinc metal sheeting and tubing and to buy fertilizer for his crops because besides being employed by that firm he’s also a grain farmer. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to replace the roof: zinc metal sheeting and tubing and to buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida P. is a widow who lives in Park Kambiakeke, Barangay Guiwanon, Bantayan, Cebu City.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures. She has a crab meat vending business, a dried fish vending business and she also operates a sari-sari (general) store. 

Nida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past nineteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $554, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family and her businesses and for the education of their future children. Nida P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, zona bastante conocida a nivel nacional por su desarrollo comercial y de transporte.

Ella es propietaria de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte), ella brinda su vehículo en alquiler para que sea utilizado brindando servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros. Esta actividad es bastante rentable pues las mototaxis constituyen una alternativa de transporte bastante utilizada en las zonas marginales de la ciudad.

Ana desea brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que debido al continuo uso, su unidad movil necesita de mantenimiento constante. Para realizar esta acción ella ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora y bastante entregada a su familia. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es comerciante, con el mantenimiento de la economía familiar. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucho aprecio y estima.
texts.en:
Ana is a 33 year old mother who lives with her husband and son in an urban zone of Chiclayo; well known nationally for its business and transportation development. She owns a mototaxi (a modified motorcycle fitted with a passenger compartment), which she offers for lease, so that it can be used to provide transportation services for passengers and cargo. This is very profitable because mototaxis are a well utilized form of transportation within the marginal zones of the city. Ana wants to perform some maintenance on her vehicle. Because of its continued use, it needs constant maintenance. In order to do this, she has seen fit to request a loan of 1000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to her family. She uses the income she receives from this business activity to help her husband, who is a merchant, with the family’s financial support. Those who know her appreciate and admire her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El Sr. Juan de la C. S. C.   él  se desempeña  como Tractorista en el hotel Barceló Monte limar, tiene  doce años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, los créditos con CEPRODEL le han beneficiado mucho ya que de esa manera él  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan de la C. S. C. works as a tractor driver at the Barceló Montelimar Hotel. He has worked here for twelve years. He is currently married. Juan has had two loans with Ceprodel and has used them to buy construction materials to improve his house. The Ceprodel loans have helped him greatly because with them he has improved living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase roofing materials: Zinc, perlins, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Evelinda Del Carmen

texts.es: La  Sra. Evelinda del Carmen C. H. ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar  desempeñándose como Ama de llaves tiene  cuatro  año de trabajar para esta empresa es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los  créditos con la institución  le ha beneficiado en gran manera para mejorar su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Evelinda del Carmen C. H. works at the Barceló Montelimar Hotel as a housekeeper. She has worked at this hotel for four years. She is currently married. Evelinda has had two loans with Ceprodel and has used them to purchase construction materials and improve her house. The loans have been a great help to her in improving living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, piedrin to build a wall

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina C., 30, and her husband, Mr. Sarith Song, 38, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for four years and have one young daughter.   

Sina runs a grocery store out of her home. She buys grocery items from Koki market, which is a bit far from her house. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and farmer. She is applying for her first loan of $800 to stock additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mr. Thach H. and his wife, Mrs. Orn Chan (pictured together above), have been married since 1992. They are living in a village along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Thach has been a motor taxi driver since 1991. His wife sells fruit (mangoes) at the market; she buys mangoes on contract from fellow villagers. Thach is requesting a loan of $1,000 to build a brick and concrete room under his wooden house and to provide capital for his wife to purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To build a brick and concrete room under his wooden house and to provide capital for his wife to buy mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Mrs. Saran T., 62, is a widow with two sons and also one daughter who is married and lives outside the family home. One of her sons has full-time employment in Phnom Penh City and another one attends school. She lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saran is now old, but she is still strong enough to work. She sells Kachhay (a kind of fried cake made of sticky rice with leeks) at her home. She is applying for her first loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work. 

Mrs. Saran T. and her son are pictured here.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mr. Hong Some is 49 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sineng Horn, is 50 years old (pictured together here). They have been married since 1987 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Two of them are married and live in separate homes, one stays at home, one attends school, another one assists his parents in their business and another one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Hong and his wife are fishermen. They want to purchase a boat and boat motor to operate the business, but they do not have enough money. So Hong is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to make the purchases, and he will also use a part of the loan to buy fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase a boat, boat motor and fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Mrs. Pho Y., 39, (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Sithon Sang, 46, live in a small village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. Two of her daughters weave silk at home and the other children are in school.     

Pho has been a silk weaver for twenty years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker for fifteen years. 

Pho is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to pay for her house building fees.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and pay for her house building fees.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel C. C.  es trabajador activo de la  Empresa CEMEX de Nicaragua tiene  treinta y dos  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Operador de Equipo Pesado, es casado actualmente tiene cuatro niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera por ser la única forma para realizar este tipo de actividad en nuestros hogares basada en los ingresos de la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Daniel C. C. works for Cemex Nicaragua. For 32 years he has worked there as a Heavy Equipment Operator. He is married and has four school-age children. Daniel has had two loans from Ceprodel and has used them both to buy construction materials and improve his house. The loans have been a great help to him because they are the only way he can carry out this type of activity, based on the family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: cement, sand, piedrin, etc.

loans.name: Sotum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotum M. (shown in the photo), is 38 years old and her husband, Mr. Mean Chea, is 40 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. All of the children are in school. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sotum and her husband are farmers. They grow mushrooms on their farmland in the village. Sotum is asking for her first loan of 350 USD to help her brother buy a computer to launch his business of repairing and installing cell phone applications and MP3 and MP4 players.

loans.use: To help her brother buy a computer for his business

loans.name: Chenratan

texts.en:
Mr. Chenratana C. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Srey-at An, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. 

Chenratana is a clerk. His wife has been a garment factory worker since 1994. He requested a Kiva loan once before. Now he is asking for another loan of $800 to purchase a computer and pay school fees for his brother, who is in his fourth year of college studying management.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and pay school fees for his brother

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorbike and trailer

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Alfonso R. L. se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos tales como maíz, trigo y otros rubros, cuenta con más de doce años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para ayudarse en  la compra  de insumos, pago de mano de obra y preparación de tierras  para la siembra de sus cultivos para aumentar los niveles de producción en su finca agropecuario y así mejorar los ingresos de la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso R. L. works in agriculture, growing basic grains such as corn, wheat and others. He has done this work for more than twelve years. He is currently married. He has had three loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used all of them to help him buy supplies, pay for labor and prepare his fields for planting his crops, in order to increase his production levels on his farm and thus improve the income of his family unit.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Helping him buy planting inputs such as seeds, insecticide, urea, plowing, balanced fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Nhaun Kheav, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of their sons is a garment factory worker; the others are in school.
  
Mrs. Kong N. has been selling vegetables and meat for more than six years. She buys these products in Phnom Penh and resells them in the village. Kong has requested Kiva loans several times in the past. She is now requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoem K. (shown in the photo), 28, and her husband, Mr. Vansao Soun, 31, have been married for three years and just have a young daughter. They are living in a small village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Khoem K. has been a garment factory worker for five years. Her husband works for a brick kiln in his village. The couple does not have transportation, which costs them a lot of money when they need to travel. It’s difficult for them to manage their income to support their family. 

Hence, Khoem is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. She will be able to better manage her income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Mrs. Norm M., 49 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Em, 48 years old, have been married since 1983 and have five children - four sons and a daughter. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment factory workers and two attend school. 

Mrs. Norm M. has been in the business of buying and reselling small and flowering trees in her village since 1983. She grows some of them by herself. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to use for growing small and flowering trees to sell.

loans.use: To use for growing small and flowering trees to sell

loans.name: Araceli De La Concepción

texts.es: La  Sra. Araceli de la Concepción G. C.   ella  es Trabajadora activa  de la Alcaldía Municipal San  Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como secretaria ejecutiva, tiene  tres año de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y lo ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, y este lo está solicitando para pagos de estudios universitarios y de esta manera alcanzar más y mejores opciones en el ámbito laboral  y así obtener más ingresos que mejoren su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Araceli de la Concepción G. C. works for San Rafael del Sur City Hall as an executive secretary. She has been working here for three years. She has had two loans with Ceprodel and has used them to buy construction materials for home improvement. She is asking for this loan to pay for university studies, in this way gaining more and better options in the workplace and obtaining more income to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay University fees

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo A. is a single man who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Cangmating, Sibulan, Negros Oriental. He earns his living by operating 2 businesses, a tricycle transport and a general store. Leonilo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because he hoped for something better for his family. With the help of his past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonilo has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped him earn a monthly profit of 4,500 PHP, raising his standard of living.

For his 8th loan, Leonilo is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which he intends to use to purchase stock for his general store so that he can continue to save up for the future extension of his store and to buy a new motorcycle. Leonilo A. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, the wife of M. A., lives in the city of Kasur, which is famous for its sweetmeats. Parveen and her family are involved in the manufacture and sale of shoes. They have all been doing this work for over seven years. Parveen, her husband and her daughter are most involved in this work. Her daughter is in 8th standard and, after coming back from school, she helps her parents make shoes.

The family makes shoes based on orders which they receive from the shoe shops. Their shoes are very famous among their customers. They love doing this work because it is the only work which gives them good earnings, allowing them to afford the basic necessities of life. Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah in order to buy raw materials such as leather, glue, nails and shoe polishers in large quantities to maintain their business. Parveen and her family are hopeful that this business will make them successful and that they will soon open their own shoe shop where they will sell their shoes.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for their shoe making business

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Oeun P. is a 48-year-old married woman and a villager. She lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh. She owns a piece of farmland that she uses to grow different kinds of crops. She is married with five children. Her husband works on the farm with her. Two of Oeun P.’s children are married and have started new households, while the other three are single. Presently, Oeun P. works on the farm, which is located far from her house. She does not have a vehicle to travel to the farm fields. To solve this problem, Oeun P. decided to borrow a loan in the amount of 500 USD to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, the wife of A. M., lives in the city of Kasur, which is famous for its sweetmeats. She and her family are involved in the business of making and selling parandas (an ornament used by women to tie back their hair). This is a very famous ornament which is a big trend in eastern countries. Females love to wear parandas of different colors by matching them with their dresses.  

Nasreen and her husband are experts in the making of different kinds of parandas, from simple to embroidered to colorful ones. They have been in this business for the past six years and it has always given them a good profit. Nasreen has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy thread, beads and tassels in bulk in order to make a large quantity of parandas from them. Nasreen is hopeful that this investment will enable them to increase their sales and earn a good profit as well.

loans.use: to purchase items in bulk for making parandas

loans.name: María Nelis

texts.es: La Sra. María Nelis A. R.   ella  es Trabajadora activa  de la Alcaldía Municipal Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como auxiliar contable, tiene  cinco año de trabajar para esta empresa, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación este tipos de servicios benefician mucho a personas que dependemos de un salario en donde la institución se basa en los ingresos de la unidad familiar para otorgar estos financiamientos que mejoren el nivel de vida de cada familia asalariada.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Nelis A. R. is employed by the City of Villa El Carmen as an Assistant Accountant; she has been thus employed for five years. She has a school age son. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used for building materials and supplies for home improvements. “These kinds of services are very beneficial to people who are salaried and where the institution bases its decisions for granting loans that improve living conditions on family income.”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies: paving stones, cement, zinc metal sheeting.

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 26 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, where she works in a factory sewing clothes. In addition to her job, she raises poultry in a cage behind her house and sells the matured poultry in bulk to a middle trader. She is married with two young children; both are enrolled in primary school. Her husband, Choun Kna, (pictured) works with her in the business and also works in construction. S. will be using her loan to repair/decorate her old house which often cracks during the approaching rainfall season.

loans.use: To repair/decorate her old house

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, 40 years old, is married to M. B.. They are both very talented and hardworking people. They are involved in a shoe making business. They receive orders from shoe shops and shoe factories and by completing them, they earn a good profit. They have been doing this work for the past seven years. They are very good-natured people who always try to keep everyone happy in their surroundings.

Parveen and her husband own a small house of two rooms in the city of Kasur (famous for its sweetmeats) in Pakistan where they have been living for past eight years. They started this work after spending a year in this city and have developed a good reputation among their customers. They have applied for a loan from Asasah in order to buy raw materials such as leather, nails, and shoe polishers in bulk. This investment in their business will help them to complete their larger orders on time and to earn a good income. Parveen is a regular lender with Asasah and is in her 3rd loan cycle. In previous loan years, she never missed a meeting and always paid her installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for a shoe making business

loans.name: Lucia Iveth

texts.es: Lucia M. trabaja en un centro de labores y se ha caracterizado por ser muy dedicada a su labor ya que tiene  seis años de trabajar. Es casada y tiene un niño en edad escolar. La razón por la que ella está solicitando el crédito actualmente es para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y así proporcionarle a su hijo un techo digno donde vivir y poder desarrollarse. Está muy confiada en que el crédito le será proporcionado y de esta manera podrá ver cumplido su sueño de tener su vivienda en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Lucia Iveth M. O. works for the Village Hall in Carmen as a secretary. She has worked here for six years. She is married and has one school-age son. Lucia has had five loans with Ceprodel and has used them to buy construction materials to improve her house. This repair is changing the roof, and she must also pay for labor. She believes the help offered by these institutions is very useful because payments are based on salary and an analysis of family income.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: Perlins, zinc, doors, iron, cement, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 25, is a garment factory laborer who sews clothes. S. has a life partner in her husband who is a metal polisher. He owns a machine to provide his service. The couple lives with two young children who attend the local public school. 

S. has been hiring taxis at a high price for the purpose of traveling. She is hoping to cut down this cost and is requesting a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring taxis. 

Note: Mrs. S. was busy at work when the photograph was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Buth

texts.en: Mrs. Buth R. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh city. Buth R. is married to Heng Hun, age 28. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have four children. All of them are dependent on the family income. In addition, Buth R.’s husband takes time to work in the construction sector. In view of the coming growing season, Buth R. wants to increase her crops to sell them when they have matured. As she lacks money to use on her field, Buth R. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to be used towards planting rice crops.

loans.use: To be used towards planting rice crops

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon S.'s main source of income comes from repairing and welding of vehicles for local community members. She is 46 years old, married and has eight school-age children. They are from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. Corazon has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio J. trabaja en un centro de labores del municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Tiene siete  años de trabajar para esta empresa, tiene un niño en edad escolar al que tiene la responsabilidad de proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. 

El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda porque tiene el sueño de proporcionarle a su hijo excelentes condiciones de vida y así seguir avante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar J. G. works at the San Rafael del Sur Town Hall as a security guard. He has worked here for six years. He has one school-aged child. Julio has had five loans with Ceprodel and has used them to purchase construction materials and improve his house. He has always shown great responsibility in paying his debts, and he appreciates the hard work these institutions do for the poor, 'who are dependent on low incomes, and if it were not for the help of these organizations, we would not be able to do any of these things to improve the life of each employee.'

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, piedrin

loans.name: Shadaan

texts.en:
Shadaan lives in a small city called Kasur which is located near Lahore, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She is married to M. H. who is 60 years old and has a business selling milk. He operates his business from his home where he keeps three buffalos.

Shadaan is a housewife but she also helps her husband in his business. She takes care of buffalos by giving them food and water on time and by keeping their place clean to make sure they don’t catch any disease.

Shadaan has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her children left their education and started to work at an early age to support the family. All three sons are now attached to a shoemaking business, working in a factory near their home on monthly wages. Her daughter sews clothes for her neighborhood clients.

Shadaan has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo which will increase the milk production. As a result, her husband will be able to supply a larger quantity of milk and earn more income.

Shadaan is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 3rd loan. Over the years she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es: Francisco José G. el es trabajador del municipio de San Rafael del Sur desde hace cinco  años. Tiene un niño en edad escolar por lo que está en el deber de proporcionerle todas las condiciones necesarias para que pueda estudiar y así llegar a ser un gran profesional. Con este crédito tiene proyectado la compra de cemento, arena, y piedrín así como el pago de la mano de obra para el mejoramiento de su vivienda porque ha estado en malas condiciones pero ha tomado la decisión de iniciar esta labor y así proporcionarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias por medio de un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Francisco José G. Z. works at the San Rafael del Sur Town Hall as a maintenance worker. He has worked here for five years. He has one school-age son. Francisco has had three loans with Ceprodel and has used them to buy construction materials and improve his house. With this loan, he plans to buy cement, sand and piedrin [a type of building material] and pay for labor. He also appreciates the existence of these organizations who offer help to people with low incomes who cannot afford on their own to make these home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, piedrin

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío El Sandial, una zona agrícola situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. Especialmente en el rubro de ganadería, el cría vacas para aprovechar la leche que producen, la cual comercializa con un acopiador de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz. Con estas actividades el sostiene los gastos económicos de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantenerlas.

Elmer desea adquirir alimento balanceado para aumentar la producción de su ganado, para lograr este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Con esta inversión el podrá mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. El es una persona tranquila y responsable. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien de confianza y servicial.
texts.en:
Elmer is a 27 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the “El Sandial” Hamlet, an agricultural zone located in the Pítipo province of Ferreñafe. This area is located more than an hour from Chiclayo. He’s been involved in agricultural activities since he was young, especially in raising livestock. He raises cattle so that he can take advantage of the milk they produce, which he sells to a consolidator in the zone. He also raises corn. It is through these means that he supports his family financially, and always gives his all to support them. Elmer wants to buy balanced feed in order to increase the production of his livestock. In order to accomplish this objective, he has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,000 PEN, through Edpyme Alternativa. This investment will allow him to improve his business and quality of life. He is a calm, responsible person. People in his zone know him as someone of trust and servitude.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animal feed

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara S. is the leader of this group. She is forty six and married with four children: her daughters are fifteen and twenty and her sons are twenty and twenty-four. Her elder son works in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan), her second son is farmer, her elder daughter is a student and her youngest daughter goes to school. Her husband is veterinarian.

As their children grow, their expenses grow too. Therefore, in order to provide for all the members of the family, Gulnara decided to start cattle breeding. She is applying for a loan to buy cattle that she is planning to fatten and sell at a higher price. With the profits, she is planning to continue construction of her new house and improve her family’s living conditions.

The other group members are:

Ryskul K. K. is the treasurer of the group. She is twenty and single. She already applied for a loan before and used the loan to buy cattle for breeding. She successfully resold the cattle at a higher price after fattening and repaid the loan. Now she wants to continue cattle breeding and therefore is again applying for a loan in order to buy cattle for fattening and sale. She plans to spend the profits from cattle breeding on the purchase of more cattle for breeding. This is how she plans to significantly increase the number of her cattle.

Alymkul K. is fifty and married. She has five children: her sons are fifteen and twenty-five and her daughters are twelve, twenty and twenty-four years old. Her husband is veterinarian. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. Now, she plans to increase the number of her cattle. Thus, she is applying for a loan that will help her to buy cattle for fattening and sale. She plans to divide the profits from cattle breeding and use part of them on the payment of her daughter’s tuition fees to the institution of higher education and another part on the purchase of more cattle.

Aida Z. is thirty-three and married. She has two children: her daughter is ten and her son is twelve. Both of them go to school. Her husband is a builder and Aida is a teacher at the local school. Still, they decided to breed cattle two years ago in order to make additional income. They applied for a loan and bought cattle. However, they want to continue to increase the number of their cattle and therefore they are applying for a loan. With the profits from cattle breeding, Aida wants to reinvest in cattle breeding and spend some on the continuation of her house construction.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for fattening and sale

loans.name: Kaiyrsa's Group

texts.en: Kaiyrsa S. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-seven and a widow. She has three sons and they are twenty-three, twenty-eight and thirty-three. Her two elder sons work in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) and her youngest son has a childhood disability. Her elder sons live independently and help Kaiyrsa to provide for herself and her youngest son. Still, Kaiyrsa decided to start cattle breeding in order to have an additional source of income and therefore applied for this loan. Also, according to Kyrgyz national traditions she has to celebrate her grandson’s first birthday. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have sufficient funds to do so. Only with the help of the loan will she be able to purchase cattle and to celebrate her grandson’s birthday. The other group members are: Altynbiubiu I. is the treasurer of the group. She is forty and married with two children: her son is fourteen and her daughter is five. Her husband is a forester while her elder son goes to school and her youngest daughter is at home. Altynbiubiu sells consumer goods, mostly office and school accessories. She started her business after her marriage upon the suggestion of her friend. Now, she is already six years in business after starting with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. She earns 9,000 soms each month from her business and, with the help of her husband, she also breeds cattle. With the profits from her business and cattle breeding, she is able to purchase household appliances and significantly increase the number of her cattle. Now she is planning to expand her business and therefore is applying for a loan which would help her to purchase additional cattle and purchase goods in order to the increase turnover of her business. Chyngyz M. U. is twenty and single and lives with his mother and father, both of whom are pensioners. He decided to start cattle breeding in order to provide for his family. He is applying for a loan to buy cattle for fattening and sale. Ishenbiubiu A. is sixty-two and married. She is a pensioner with a son twenty-four years old. Her son works at a local center of national education and receives 3,000 soms as a monthly salary. Ishenbiubiu is applying for a loan in order to start breeding cattle. She is planning to purchase cattle and hay for feed. With the help of her son, she will fatten the cattle for sale at a higher price. With the profits, she is planning to increase the number of her cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and to celebrate her grandson’s birthday

loans.name: Chhab

texts.en:
Chhab is a 44-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and three children. He is the owner of a pickup truck, which he uses for transporting many things for people from one place to another, especially for construction use.

Chhab also transports vegetables and fruits from the wholesale market to his clients’ shops. Everyone likes him as he’s very honest and helpful, and seeks perfection in serving others.

This is the first time that Chhab has requested a loan from A. Majmoua, and it’s all because he needs to replace the pickup’s engine, do other necessary maintenance, and change its officiA. papers.

Money was Chhab’s main obstacle when starting his business, and its need made him more excited to fight for his success. He hopes to expand his business through buying more pickup trucks in the future.

loans.use: To replace the pickup truck’s engine, do necessary maintenance, and change its official papers

loans.name: Kenzhegul's Group

texts.en: Kenzhegul O. is the leader of this group. She is thirty-three and married with five children: her elder sons are eleven and nine years old and her daughters are six, three and one year old. Her husband is a general worker. Together with her husband, Kenzhegul decided to start a cattle breeding business ten years ago. Her husband helps her with the cattle breeding. They decided to continue cattle breeding but, unfortunately, they don’t have cattle at present. They are applying for a loan to buy cattle for breeding. The other group members are: Gulbaraim S. is thirty-five and a widow. She has two children: her daughter is thirteen and her son is two years old. Her daughter goes to school and her son is at home. Gulbaraim is applying for a loan in order to obtain money for family needs. She needs to buy school accessories and clothes for her child and some other things for her youngest child. In the future, she plans to start a cattle breeding business and increase the number of her cattle. Stalbek S. is thirty-two and married. He breeds cattle and is already ten years in the business. He is applying for a loan in order to obtain funds for family needs. He is planning to repay this loan with the help of profits from his cattle breeding business. Sattybek S. is thirty-seven and married with two children: his son is eleven and his daughter is eight years old. Both of them go to school. His wife is housewife. Sattybek, with the help of his wife, breeds cattle. He decided to start cattle breeding ten years ago after his marriage and now he makes 8,000 soms monthly. He was able to buy a car and significantly increase the number of his cattle from the profits. He is applying for a loan in order to buy more cattle for breeding that will help him to further increase the number of his cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca P. is from the village of Lower Cogon, Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Rebecca is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for more than nine years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Nurzhamal's Group

texts.en:
Nurzhamal D. is leader of the group. She is 36 and married. She has three children: her sons are 15 and 5 and her daughter is 12. Her elder two children go to school and her youngest son is at home. Her husband works in construction. 

Nurzhamal breeds cattle and sells milk. She started cattle breeding seven years ago with an initial investment of 16,000 soms. Their parents helped them with the purchase of a milk cow. Her husband actively helps her in breeding cattle and combining their efforts, They get 2,300 soms monthly.  They are applying for a loan to buy more cattle for breeding. With the profits from cattle breeding, they are planning to build a big barn, and buy a house and a car. 

Group members:
Mubarhan T. is 48 and married. She has seven children: her sons are 25, 23, 20, 17, 13 and her daughters are 19 and 15. Her daughters are married and live independently; her elder two sons are also married and live independently; one of her sons is a student and the two youngest sons go to school.  Her husband is a guard at the local school. She is a farmer, breeds cattle and sells milk. They sold crops from their garden and used the proceeds to buy a milk cow. During the last eight years, she makes 2,600 soms monthly from cattle breeding, milk selling and farming. With the profits from her business, she could pay for the marriage of her children and increase the number of cattle. Now she is applying for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle for fattening and reselling at a higher price. In the future, she is planning to increase cattle quantity and marry off her youngest sons. 

Zhibek M. is 29 and married. She has three children: her son is 9, her daughter is 8nand her second son is 2 years old. Her elder son and daughter go to school and her youngest son is at home. Her husband breeds cattle. She farms, helps her husband with cattle breeding and sells milk. They started farming, cattle breeding and selling milk because this business was inherited from their parents.  Now, they have run the business for 10 year and they make 3,000 soms monthly. They are planning to make repairs at their house. She is applying for a loan to purchase construction materials and prepare their house for the winter. She is planning to finish construction on her house and buy a car. 

Akylai K. is 41 and married. She has five children: her sons are 20, 5 and 3 years old and her daughters are 18 and 16 years old. Her elder son helps her to take care of their house, her daughters are students and her youngest son is at home. Her husband is a farmer; he breeds cattle and sells milk together with his wife. She inherited this business from her parents. They have run the business for 21 years and they make 1,500 soms a month. For now, they could significantly increase the cattle number and buy a tractor. She is applying for a loan in order to buy fuels and lubricants for their tractor and gather crops. In the future, she is planning to build a new barn, buy a new car and make repairs on her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is from Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is the resident of a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan called Kasur. Kasur is known for its leather industry. 
She is a 46-year-old housewife who is married to M. A. and has given birth to four sons and two daughters. 

For the last 15 years, Zarina’s husband has been involved in the business of making shoes. He operates his business from his home. He collects orders from different shoe stores and provides them finished goods to earn an income for his family. 

Zarina’s three elder sons help their father in his business. They started to support their father after they completed their 10th standard grade in school. Zarina also helps her husband in his business in her spare time. 

Due to an increase in manpower, Zarina’s husband now can produce larger quantities of shoes and offer his services to more clients. But in order to produce shoes in larger quantities, he needs more raw materials, such as nails, shoe polish and leather.  

Therefore, Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. The loan amount will help him to buy raw materials used in manufacturing shoes in larger quantities, which will help him fulfill larger orders on time. 

Zarina is hopeful that her family business will grow as a result of investing money into it.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for shoe-making business

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira M. is leader of the group. She is 54 and married. She has two children: her son is 20 and daughter is 14. Her son is a student at an institution of higher education In Kyrgyzstan and her daughter studies in the US. Her husband works in construction. Two years ago, she bought an apparatus for wool scratching with her savings. Since then, she has offered the service of wool scratching. Two years ago, the apparatus cost her 13,500 and now she can get 7,200 soms a month from it. Along with wool scratching, Gulmira decided to start cattle breeding. She applied for a loan to purchase cattle. In the future, Gulmira plans to marry off her son, give her daughter a better education and buy a car.

Group members:
Sovetkan A. is treasurer of the group. She is 34 and married. She has two daughters of 6 and 3 years old. Both of them are at home. Together with her husband, Sovetkan decided to start cattle breeding. She applied for a loan in order to buy cattle for reselling. In the future, with the profits from cattle breeding, Sovetkan plans to educate her children, form a dowry for her daughters and expand her business. 

Asylbek C. is 54 and married. He has two children: his daughter is 25 and his son is 20. His daughter is married and his son is a student. His wife is a teacher in the US. He works as an inspector in the factory “Severelektro”. He plans to start cattle breeding, but he needs funds. Therefore he is applying for a loan to buy cattle for breeding. He plans, in the future, to continue cattle breeding.

Ashat B. is 21 and single. He breeds cattle. He started one year ago, with the purchase of cattle with his own savings from his salary of 12,000 soms. He gets 6,000 soms monthly from cattle breeding.  He is applying for a loan in order to buy cattle for fattening and reselling in the future at a higher price. With the profits from cattle breeding, Ashat plans to buy a house, car, more cattle and save some money for his future wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is from Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira N. is leader of the group. She is 25 and married. She has two children: her daughter is 5 and her son is 2 years old. Both of her children are at home. She sells convenience goods at her shop which is on her property at her home. She started her business with construction of the shop using her personal savings and the purchase of convenience goods with the help of a loan. Having started her business four years ago with an initial investment of 7,000 soms, she now earns 7,800 soms monthly. With the profits from her business, she wants to buy household appliances. Now, she is applying for a loan in order to increase her inventory. She is planning to purchase convenience goods and resell them at her shop. In the future, she is planning to build a big shop, expand her business and buy an automobile. 

Group members:
Damira A. is treasurer of the group. She is 53 and married. She has seven children: her sons are 32, 30, 27 and her daughters are 34, 26, 22 and 18 years old.  Her elder four children live independently with their own families, her two daughters work in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan) and her youngest daughter is a student. Damira breeds cattle. She started cattle breeding three years ago with an initial investment of 25,000 soms and she receives 24,000 soms as profit from her cattle breeding business monthly. With the profits from cattle breeding, she wants to educate and marry off her children. She is planning to buy a cow and is applying for a loan.  In the future, she wishes to increase her cattle quantity, buy a car and new household appliances.  

Ainagul S. is 27 and married. She has two children: her eldest son is 8 and her youngest son is 3 years old. Ainagul, with the help of her husband, breeds cattle. They started cattle-breeding because they inherited the cattle. Having started their business with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, they make 10,000 monthly. Before, Ainagul was selling convenience goods. Now, she wants continue her business. Therefore she is applying for a loan because it would give her an opportunity to buy goods for selling. In the future, she is planning to expand her business and increase cattle quantity. 

Soltobek T. is 63 and married. He has five children: his sons are 40, 39, 34, 33 and 10 years old. His elder son works in the State Motor Licensing and Inspection Department, his second son is a worker, his third son is tractor driver and his youngest son goes to school. Right now, Soltobek is a taxi driver. He bought a car on savings for 50.000 soms seven years ago. His monthly income is 11.000 soms. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase auto parts to fix his car. In the future, he is planning to buy a house for his son and buy a new car. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is from Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience store goods

loans.name: Aitilla's Group

texts.en:
Aitilla I. is thirty-nine and married. She has two daughters who are four and eight. Her elder daughter goes to school and her younger daughter stays at home. Her husband is a guard at local school. Aitilla works at the local school also as a cleaner. 

She and her husband also breed cattle. She started seven years ago upon the suggestion of her friend. Now, she gets 4,000 soms from cattle breeding. She applied for a loan and successfully repaid it. She could increase quantity of cattle to seven.  She wants to purchase additional cattle for breeding, therefore she has applied for another loan.
