Johanna de 23 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Hace unos meses atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había, poco a poco la ha venido surtiendo con aceites, arroz, bebidas etc. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo atendiendo en las tardes la tienda. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo aceite, arroz y bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener una despensa de vivieres, y mejorar su casa y que es de ladillos.
texts.en:
Johanna is 23 years old and lives in the periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountainous roads. She has a small store that is set up in the front of her house.

A few months ago she started her general store since this type of business did not exist in her area. Johanna gradually stocked her business with oil, rice, beverages, and other products. She works with the help of her husband, who manages the store in the afternoons.

In order to restock her business, Johanna will use this loan to buy oil, rice, and beverages. In the future, she wants to open a food pantry and make improvements to her brick house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For sand and cement.

loans.name: Darba

texts.fr: darba est une femme dynamique. elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de produits de beauté, produits pharmaceutiques et de parfums; elle a une ancienneté de 8 ans dans ce commerce et fait son commerce à domicile. le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. elle sollicite de WAGES pour pouvoir s'approvisionner un crédit lui permettant d'acheter des produits, pharmaceutiques, des produits de beauté et divers parfums.
texts.en:
Darba is a dynamic woman. She is married and the mother of one child. She retails beauty products, pharmaceutical products and perfumes to earn a living. She has 8 years of seniority in this commerce and runs her business at home. Her current inventory does not allow her to meet her clients’ needs. She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products, beauty products and various perfumes.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena 43 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 1 año que busca la manera de mantener a sus 2 hijos que Maria es una mujer emprendedora, ella es su propia jefa de su negocio pues se levanta todos los días temprano para ofrecer la variedad de sus productos, tiene clientes que cada día le solicitan diferente productos. Maria desea el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su negocio y comprar toallas, ropa, calzado y otros productos. Por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 43 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than a year in order to support her two children. She is an enterprising woman who enjoys being the boss of her own business. Maria wakes up early every day so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers who request different items from her on a daily basis.

She wants to use this loan to maintain her business, so she plans to buy towels, clothing, shoes, and other products. Maria is committed to completing her payments in a timely and accurate manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase towels, clothing, shoes, and other products

loans.name: Mario Esteven

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Esteven C. T. el es trabajador de la empresa “Walter Zamora Estrada” desempeñándose como conductor de camión, tiene  cuatro  año de trabajarle a esta empresa, es acompañado actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para compra de materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de repuestos para el motor de un carro y cambiarle el techo a su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Esteven C. T. is employed by a firm called “Walter Zamora Estrada” as a truck driver. He has been thus employed for four years. He has a school age son. He has had two CEPRODEL loans that he used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvement. This loan will be used to buy vehicle engine replacement parts and to replace the roof on his house. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi replacement parts and to buy zinc metal sheeting and tubing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For sand, concrete blocks, cement, iron rods.

loans.name: Pastora Isolina

texts.es:
Pastora de 37 años,elabora peluches y almohadas, tiene una casa de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. 

Hace varios años ella inicio la producción de almohada y peluches para poder mantener a su familia. Comenzó con una maquina de coser vieja, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener mas clientela. Su esposo se va a las provincias del Ecuador a vender las almohadas y peluches. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar espuma y telas para la elaboración y una mayor producción de almohadas y peluches. En el futuro quiere tener un almacén para que sus ventas sean al por mayor.
texts.en:
Pastora is 37 years old and produces stuffed toys and pillows. She has a house made of reeds and receives electricity as her only basic service. Pastora lives in the periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area known for its mountain roads.

Several years ago she began producing pillows and stuffed toys in order to support her family. She started with an old sewing machine and, with a little bit of effort, was able to acquire more customers. Her husband travels to the provinces throughout Ecuador to sell the pillows and stuffed toys.

Pastora wants to use this loan to buy foam and fabrics so that she can increase her production of pillows and stuffed toys. In the future, she wants to have a store where she can sell in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase foam & fabrics

loans.name: Yali

texts.es: Yali de 31 años, no tiene hijos. El se caracteriza por ser una persona exigente y de mucho carácter. En la actualidad su negocio de venta de refrescos y gaseosas es muy conocido, debido a la buena crítica que obtuvo por parte sus clientes, es por ello que se siente contento por la actividad que realiza, Su plan a futuro es poder comprar un extractor de jugos pues todos sus refrescos los realiza manual. Con el crédito que solicita será destinado para la compra de melones, mangos, limones, naranjas, sandias, azucare, bolsas entre otras, con el objetivo de satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yali is 31 years and does not have children. He is known for being a determined person of sound character. He currently has a business that is well-known for selling refreshments and soft drinks. His customers give him good reviews, which makes him happy about the work he performs. Yali’s plan for the future is to buy a juicer so that he can make all kinds of handmade refreshments. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy melons, mangoes, limes, oranges, watermelons, sugar, bags, and other supplies in order to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase melons, mangoes, limes, oranges, watermelons, sugar, bags, and other supplies

loans.name: Luis Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Luis Adolfo S. V.   él  se desempeña  como Guarda de seguridad en la Universidad de Carazo “UNAN”, tiene  cuatro años de trabajar para esta institución, tiene cuatro  niños en edad escolar, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de repuestos de una Moto Taxi, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera en su  vida familiar.
texts.en:
Luis Adolfo S. V. works as a security guard at the Universidad de Carazo (UNAN) and has been working for the institution for four years. He is currently married and has four school-aged children. He has had four loans through CEPRODEL and he has used them to purchase construction materials to make housing improvements. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for a moto taxi. The loans with CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts for a moto taxi

loans.name: Adolfo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Adolfo tiene 30 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de ganado, este negocio consiste en comprar y vender ganado, el realiza sus compras en comunidades ya que aquí consigue al ganado a precio mucho más favorable, siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos a su familia. Sus inicios se dan por su Papa quien le enseño este oficio y cuando tenía la edad de 7 años le regalo un ternero y así poco a poco fue logrando comprar vacas, toros y ternero y tener su propio negocio, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con crédito pues ha sido reconfortante para su negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de terneros, vacas, toros entre otros.
texts.en:
Sr. Adolfo is 30 years old and makes his living by buying and selling cattle. He purchases the animals in the community since he is able to get a very favorable price.

Adolfo is always looking for ways to generate income for his family. He started in this business with his father, who began teaching him when he was seven years old. His father gave him a calf and over time Adolfo was able to buy cows, bulls, and more calves to start his own business. This is not his first experience with loans since they have been beneficial for his business.

At the moment, Adolfo is requesting a loan in order to buy calves, cows, bulls, and other types of livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves, cows, and bulls

loans.name: Djabirou

texts.fr: marié et père d'un enfant, monsieur D. exerce  comme activité le commerce de bois de chauffage,il est un homme à exercer ce commerce, ce qui pousse la curiosité des gens qui viennent acheter chez lui. sa clientèle est grandissante, il doit renouveler son stock pour bien les satisfaire. il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l'achat dune dizaine de tas de bois de chauffe. il s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays.
texts.en:
Married and the father of one child, Mr. D. is engaged in the selling of firewood. He is the man to have this business, which rouses curiosity in the people who come to his home to buy. His clientele is growing and he has to replace his stock in order to satisfy it. He is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy about ten stacks of firewood. He stocks up in the interior of the country.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos José E. F. él Trabaja por cuenta propia brindando el servicio de perifoneo o propaganda tiene  diez  años de trabajar en  esta actividad. Es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho mejorar su negocio y este lo está solicitando para la compra de dos bocinas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo, los créditos le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos José E. F. works freelance providing megaphone or advertising services. He has been working in this business for ten years. He is currently married and has a school-aged son. He has had eight loans with CEPRODEL and he has used each one to improve his business. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two loudspeakers and to provide maintenance to his vehicle. The loans have benefited him in a great way since, as a result, he has improved his living condition and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two loudspeakers and for car maintenance

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la administración de su propio restaurante donde prepara desayunos y almuerzos, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar su local comprando sillas y mesas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sillas y mesas para mejorar su restaurante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “Capac Qoya”, which is located in the District of Coya in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Graciela is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She divides her time between her daily activities and managing her own restaurant where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Graciela works from 6am until 7pm. She wants to improve her business by acquiring chairs and tables, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Graciela thanks everyone who has helped fulfill her dream, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: cette femme est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle a appris le métier de la coiffure.pour accroître ses revenus quotidiens, elle a associé à son activité la vente de produits cosmétiques. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. elle veut gonfler son stock pour accroître ses recettes, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 4 cartons de mèches,3 cartons de tissage et divers autres produits de beauté.
texts.en:
This woman is married and mother of two children. She is a trained hair dresser and to increase her revenue she also sells cosmetic products. She has been in this business since 2003 and she buys her products at the big open market in Lomé. She would like to improve her stock of articles in order to increase the profits and for this reason she requests a loan to purchase four boxes of hair extensions, three boxes of wigs and other different beauty products.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Héctor Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor Danilo R. V. es trabajador activo de la  Empresa WACKENHUT tiene  DOS  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como supervisor de guarda de seguridad es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor Danilo R. V. is an active worker at the Wackenhut Corporation. He has been working at this institution for two years as supervisor of security watch. He is currently married. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL and he has used each one to purchase construction materials and make improvements to the house where he lives. The loans have been of great benefit to him since, as a result, he has improved his living condition and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sand, cement, gravel, and labor.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz de 28 años, es casada y juntos tienen un hijo a su cargo. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de cerdos, recuerda que se inició desde pequeña por sus padres, pero al poco tiempo notó que este negocio tenía mucha demanda, desde luego que siguió con esta actividad. Actualmente  su negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos económicos, además tiene más de 3 años con este negocio ya que siempre esta brindado un buen servicio y esto les gusta a sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su local. Este es su primer crédito se encuentra muy emocionada por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas establecidas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en:
Ada Luz is 28 years old, married, and has one child under her care. Her business consists of buying and selling pigs. She recalls starting in this business as a little girl with her parents, but she soon noticed that this type of activity has great demand, so she continued with this business on her own. Currently her business is the main source of her income. Ada Luz has had her business for more than three years and she always provides good service that her customers enjoy. Her plan for the future is to expand her business and improve its conditions.

This is the first loan she has received and she is very excited. She promises to complete her payments on the established due dates. With this loan she requested, Ada Luz plans to invest in the purchase of pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire pigs

loans.name: Conteh United Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the C. United Group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They run small businesses and have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Obai C.. Obai was born in Magburaka town 40 years ago. He is married and has three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. Obai sells medicines and has been doing this business for five years now. He will use his share of this loan to buy more medicines to sell.

loans.use: To buy more medicines

loans.name: Work Fine Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Work Fine Group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 leones each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ibrahim S. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. This 48-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have seven children, four of whom are still attending school. Ibrahim has been a tailor for 15 years now. He will use his share of this loan to buy working materials in large quantity.

loans.use: To buy working materials in large quantity

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia; ella tiene 77 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chompas, ella teje las chompas y los vende en diferentes lugares como Arequipa y Chile, la socia también tiene un pequeño terreno donde produce maíz y papas, la socia quiere mejorar sus tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y semillas para el terreno de cultivo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Capac Qoya”, which is located in the District of Coya in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Celia is 77 years old, married, and has three children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling sweaters. Celia weaves the sweaters and then sells them in different places such as Arequipa and Chile. She also has a small plot of land where she grows corn and potatoes. Celia wants to improve her farmland, so she is requesting a loan to buy compost, fertilizers, and seeds.

She thanks everyone who has helped fulfill her dream, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost, fertilizers, and seeds

loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Pablo Alfonso M. L. él se dedica a la compra y venta de leche tiene tres camionetas propias que son sus medios de trasporte para la venta de la leche trabaja a diario   tiene  catorce años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casado actualmente tiene cuatro niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para la  compra y venta de leche pero este lo está solicitando para ajustar para la compra de una descremadora, los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de su negocio  de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo Alfonso M. L. works in the purchase and sale of milk. He owns three trucks which are his means of transport for his milk sales. He works daily and has been in this business for fourteen years. He is currently married and has four school-aged children. He has had nine loans through CEPRODEL and he has used each one for the purchase and sale of milk. However, he is requesting his loan to purchase a machine for skimming milk. The loans have benefited him in a great way since, as a result, he has improved the condition of his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a machine for skimming milk

loans.name: Paula Isidora

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada al trabajo, pues tiene dos trabajos para lograr ajustar con los gastos.
Hoy en día trabaja como conserje un trabajo fijo.
 y venta de comida y cosméticos los cuales  vende en su mismo trabajo, ya que pidió permiso para poder vender y así poder obtener ingresos que le ayuden apoyar a sus hijos ya que es una de muchas madre soltera.
Atreves de estos financiamiento ha podido hacer mejoras a su vivienda, como mejorar el inventario de su pequeño negocio. Con once ciclos en Afodenic. El cual esta cada día esforzándose en colocar sus ventas y saldar los pagos correspondientes.
Comprara productos de cosméticos como: perfumes, de dama y caballeros, vanidad, talco, cremas de cuerpo, pintura de labio, maquillaje. A si como comprar granos básicos, carne, pollo, lácteos, verduras para la elaboración de comida.
Como objetivo es poder seguir vendiendo para tener mejores ingreso que ayuden a solventar los gastos alimenticos y gastos estudiantiles de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula is a hard-working woman who is devoted to her work. She has two jobs to manage to cover her expenses. She now works as a janitor, which is a steady job. She also sells food and cosmetics at her job. She asked permission to be able to sell in order to get income to help support her children. She is one of many single mothers. Through the loans she has been able to make improvements on her house and improve the inventory of her small business. She has had 11 cycles with Afodenic, in which she works hard everyday to make her sales and settle her corresponding payments. She will buy cosmetic products like perfume for men and women, cosmetic bags, talc, body creams, lipstick and makeup. She will also buy basic grains, meat, chicken, dairy products, and vegetables to make food. Her objective is to be able to keep selling in order to have better income. She wants more income to help pay food expenses and her children’s educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, chicken, meat, and dairy products to continue making food to sell and cosmetics, a source of income

loans.name: Brenda Lisset

texts.es: Brenda tiene 33 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio para mantener a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de  desodorantes, pinturas de uñas, lápiz labial, cremas,  perfumes y tratamientos. El deseo de Branda es que sus hijos logren mantener este negocio.
texts.en:
Brenda, 33, sells cosmetics. She’s a very active and dynamic young woman. She enjoys her work very much. This isn’t her first loan since they have been very satisfactory for her to keep her customers. She is asking for financing to buy deodorants, nail polish, lipstick, creams, perfumes and beauty treatments. Brenda’s wish is that her children continue to manage to keep this business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Trust In We Group

texts.en:
These are women with small-scale businesses in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will each be able to add more stock to their business, make more sales, and make more profit. 

Ramatu K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni forty-two years ago and is married with three children. Her husband works for the city council and one of her children is attending primary school. 

Ramatu sells slippers and has been doing this for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more slippers wholesale to add to her stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy slippers in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Lane Kuru” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan they will each be able to expand their business, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Wara T. is the leader of this group. The forty-five-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Wara has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells locally dyed cloth (gara lappers) and cotton cloth. With her share of this loan, she will buy materials for making gara lappers like ink, caustic soda, powder, etc., so that she can produce dozens of gara lappers to sell.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more gara lappers to sell

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fabiana; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es casada; La socia  trabajaba vendiendo golosinas en un triciclo, ella y su esposo que es taxista desean juntos ahorrar para comprar sus artefactos para el hogar y desean tener sus hijos en poco tiempo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sus golosinas para implementar su negocio y mejorar sus ventas. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fabiana, 26, is married and is a member of the “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO” comnunal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She works selling sweets from a three-wheeled cart. She and her husband, who is a taxi driver, want to save up to buy home appliances and would like to start having children soon. She is asking for funds to buy sweets to stock her business and improve her sales. She is grateful to those who are part of this dream by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets to stock her cart.

loans.name: Aoussi

texts.fr: B. est une dame de 45 ans très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.en 1999 elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de céréales, plus tard elle associé à ce commerce la vente d'ignames pour pouvoir réaliser de gros profits.  elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville d'anié. son anciennété dans ce commerce lui en a donné une parfaite maîtrise. elle a djà obtenu chez WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour pouvoir acheter 5 tas de tubercules et 6 sacs de maïs, le reste sera destiné à assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
B. is a very dynamic lady, with 45 years of age. She is married and has two children. In 1999 she began selling grain, later associated with the yam sale, in order to increase the revenue. She buys her products in the interior of the country, in the city of Anie. With all the years of experience she has become an expert trader. She received from WAGES a previous loan, that she fully repaid, and now she is requesting a second one to purchase five lots of six bags of potatoes and corn each; the rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transportation.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain and yam

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar Antonio G.  G. él es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Asistente de servicios municipales tiene  dos  años de trabajar para esta empresa es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Antonio G. G. is an employee of the town hall of San Rafael del Sur. He has been working for this institution for two years and he works as a municipal services assistant. He is currently married. He has had three loans through CEPRODEL and he has used them for the purchase of construction materials and to improve the house where he lives. The loans have benefited him in a great way since, as a result, he has improved his living condition and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito D. Coya, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Filomena; ella tiene 46 años D. edad y es casada y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. crianza D. animales menores como cuyes y gallinas y luego los venD. en las diferentes ferias que se realizan en el distrito D. Calca, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio D. crianza D. animales menores y construir un galpón para cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Filomena, 46, is married and has two children. She is a member of the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank located in Coya district, Calca province, Cusco department. She combines her daily household activities with raising small farm animals, like chickens, that she then sells at the various markets that take place in Calca district. She wants to improve her business and build a pen for the guinea pigs. She is asking for funds to buy small farm animals. She is grateful to those who are part of this dream by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

loans.name: We Believe God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “We Believe God” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Zainab F.. She is age thirty-five; she was born in Matotoka village about eight miles from Magburaka town, where she is currently living with her husband and five children. Her husband is a teacher; two of her children are attending primary school and three are in secondary school. 

For many years now, Zainab has been selling pepper and palm-oil. With this loan, she will buy pepper and palm-oil wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy pepper and palm-oil wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Mileyddiss Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Mileyddiss Gabriela N. G.   ella  es Trabajadora activa  de la Empresa Laboratorio Panzyma del crucero  desempeñándose como recepcionista, tiene  un año de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mileyddiss Gabriela N. G. is employed by Laboratorio Panzyma in El Crucero. She’s a Recptionist and has worked for this firm for a year. She’s married. She’s had two loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. The loans have been of great benefit to her in that they have improved her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For paving stones, sand and cement.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicia; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es viuda; La socia tiene 5 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende comidas en el mercado, La socia elabora las viandas todos los días muy temprano y los lleva a vender en el mercado de forma ambulatoria, ella desea poner su restaurante en el futuro, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes y continuar con la elaboración de comidas caseras. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Felicia, 49, is a widow. She has five children and is a member of the “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She combines her household activities with retail. She sells prepared meals in the market. She prepares her dishes daily very early and takes them to the market to sell in an ambulatory manner. She’d like to set up a restaurant in the future. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients she needs to continue to make her home-made dishes. She is grateful to those who are part of this dream by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her home-made dishes.

loans.name: Bissimilahi Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Bissimilahi” group. They are people with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Aruna T. who is age forty-five and was born in Magbese village. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children.

For ten years now, Aruna has been selling stationery (papers, pens, envelopes, etc.) and he also photocopies documents for a fee. He will use his share of the loan to buy ink, paper, pens, etc., in large quantity.

loans.use: To buy ink, papers, pens, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Dédé Philomène

texts.fr: D. est une femme très dynamique. elle a appris la coiffure et a ouvert son propre salon de coiffure qu'elle a appelé "FINE GIRL", pour augmenter son revenu elle a associé à son activité la vente de produits cosmétiques.voulant faire accroître ce dernier commerce, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des mèches, tissages et divers produits de beauté. elle a débuté ce commerce en 2004. elle est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Dédé Philomène D. is a very dynamic woman. She is a trained hairdresser and she runs her own business, "FINE GIRL" . To increase her income she enlarged her business and started selling beauty products. Now she would like to improve this part of the business and for this reason she requests a loan by WAGES to buy hair extensions, wigs and different beauty products. She started this business in 2004, she is married and mother of two children.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wigs, hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Presidente:
Francisca vive en Horacio con su pareja y uno de sus tres hijos. Tiene una bodega desde hace un año y vende un poco de todo, abarrotes y otras cosas de primera necesidad. Empezó con golosinas y frutas. Francisca está feliz que su negocio ha creciendo tanto, también le gustaría que sea más grande con mas productos como bebidas y detergentes y le gustaría construir su casa con la ayuda de los préstamos.
Tesorera:
Yeovanda tiene 3 hijos y convive con su pareja. En su tienda, ella vende productos de Esica y de Heibon desde hace ya 2 años, empezó cuando ella querría ayudar a aumentar los ingresos de su familia. Ella trabaja solamente con Edaprospo pero dice que su esposo tiene otros créditos para construir su casa. Le gustaría tener más ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y tener una tienda propia es su casa. 
Secretaria:
Leandro es casado con dos hijos mayores, desde hace 2 años el trabaja en construcción civil y antes de eso ayudo a su esposa en su venta de verduras. Están satisfechos del monto de préstamo que reciben de Edaprospo. Los prestamos son para ayudar a su esposa en su tienda, aunque les gustaría aumentar la venta y los productos que venden en ella y así salir adelante con el resto de su familia.
texts.en:
Group President Francisca lives in Horacio with her husband and one of their 3 children. She has had a general store for the last year, and she sells a little of everything, groceries and other things of primary necessity. She began with sweets and fruit. Francisca is happy that her business has grown so much, but she would like it to be much larger, with more products like drinks and detergents, and she would also like to construct her house, with the aid of loans. Treasurer Yeovanda has 3 children and lives with her husband. She has sold Esica and Heibon products in her store for the last 2 years. She began when she needed to help increase family income. She borrows only through Edaprospo but says that her husband has taken out loans for constructing their house. She would like to have more income to improve the quality of life of her children, and to have her own store in her house. Secretary Leandro is married, with 2 grown children. Since 2 years ago, he has worked in civil construction but before this, he helped his wife sell vegetables. They are satisfied with the size of the loan they will receive through Edaprospo. The loans are to help his wife in her store, and they would like to increase sales and the products they sell in the store and get ahead with the rest of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SUPPLIES AND PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: True Go Lass Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “True Go Lass” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abdul Amid G. is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a businesswoman and they have two children.

Abdul has been a businessman for six years now; he sells toothpaste, batteries, toothbrushes, and cigarettes. With his share of this loan, he will buy batteries and cigarettes in large quantity to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy batteries and cigarettes in large quantity to add to his stock

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio Cesar N. S.   él  es Trabajadora activo  de la Alcaldía Municipal Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como contador general, tiene  siete año de trabajar para esta empresa, es casado actualmente tiene dos niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar N. S. has been employed as an Accountant by the City of Villa El Carmen for the last seven years. He’s married and has two school age children. He’s had eight CEPRODEL loans that he used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. They have been of great benefit to him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For paving stones, sand and cement.

loans.name: Track Investors Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim C. is the leader of this group of youths who call their group "Track Investors”. Unlike their peers in the township of Magburaka, these guys choose to engage themselves in productive businesses in order to make a living. 

Their leader, Ibrahim C. is 28 years old. Born in Magburaka town, he is a husband and the father of one child. Ibrahim has been a businessman for five years now. He sells mobile phones, top-up cards for all four mobile networks in the country, and ice cream. With his share of this loan, Ibrahim will buy mobile phone accessories and top-up cards to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and top-up cards

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Tamemsu” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are women with small-scale businesses who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aminata F. who was born in Makeni, thirty years ago. She is married to a police officer and has three children: one of her children is attending primary school and the others are not of school-going age.

For two years now, Aminata has been selling Magi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), salt, fish, oil, etc. She will use her share of this loan to buy the above mentioned goods in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy Magi, salt, fish and oil in large quantities

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 64 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, es viuda, vive en compañía de su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más de 8 años, se dedica en la venta de ropa para niñas y niños, siendo estas vendidas de casa en casa y a crédito, puesto que previamente son pedidos de algún cliente. Es entonces que atiende a su clientela en cualquier hora del día, a quienes ya les conoce, ya que mientras va cobrando va ofreciendo las exclusividades de la mercadería que posee. Paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a coser edredones, sabanas y almohadas en su casa, en sociedad con su hermana, por lo que también tiene muchos pedidos que cumplir. Pero lo que más le gusta es el negocio y el contacto con la gente; ya que así se distrae. Su mayor anhelo es tener su taller de costuras con maquinas industriales que realicen acabados impecables y pueda confeccionar en  cantidad prendas, para así ampliar su negocio. Es su 21avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. Además le gusta trabajar con sus compañeras, por que son muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, es para la compra de más prendas, así como telas, de ese modo incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
María, 64, is a very hard working mother. She’s a widow and lives with her son in her own house. For over 8 years she has sold children’s clothes on credit door-to-door. They are previously ordered by customers. She tends to customers at all hours of the day, then, at least those who are already known to her. As she goes about collecting payment she offers the unique items she has in stock. In addition to this activity, she also makes comforters, sheets and pillows at home with her sister. She also has many pending orders for these items. But what she likes best about her business is the contact she has with people because this distracts her. Her greatest wish is to have a sewing workshop equipped with industrial sewing machines that produce impeccable finishings so that she can make items in quantity thus expanding her business. This is her 21st loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all her installments on time like she’s been doing to date. Besides, she enjoys working with her fellow group members because they are very responsible. She will use the requested loan to buy more articles of clothing as well as fabric thereby increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Celtina Auxiliadora

texts.es: La  Sra. Celtina Auxiliadora H. P.  ella es Trabajadora de la empresa ENACAL desempeñándose como cajera tiene  cuatro  años de trabajar para esta empresa es casada actualmente, tiene un hijo en la universidad. Ha tenido  cuatros créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Celtina Auxiliadora H. P. works for the ENACAL company as a cashier. She has worked for this company for four years. She is currently married, with one son at the university. She has had four loans with CEPRODEL, and she has used each one of them to buy construction materials and to improve the house where she lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, because they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, cement, stone and stone blocks

loans.name: Value Group

texts.en:
Mamusu C. (shown on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city forty-five years ago and is a widow with five children, all of whom are now grown-ups.

For many years now, Mamusu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth), firewood and charcoal.

This is not the first loan that Mamusu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Mamusu will use her SLL 800,000 share of the loan to expand her business: she will buy materials to produce more gara lappers (ink, caustic soda, powder, etc.) plus more firewood and charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy materials for making gara lappers plus more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Evangelina; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia tiene terrenos donde cultiva maíz, papa y alfalfa y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y los vende en las diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Calca, la socia quiere mejorar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos y fertilizantes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 45, is married and has two children. She’s a member of the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank located in Coya district, Calca province, Cusco department. She has fields where she grows corn, potato and alfalfa. She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs that she sells at the various markets that take place in Calca district. She’d like to improve her fields so is asking for funds to buy manure and fertilizers. She is grateful to all those who are part of this dream by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José Manuel J. vive en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur donde también tiene su familia la que depende de él completamente. El señor Jarquín actualmente está solicitando un crédito porque está comprometido con su familia en mejorar las condiciones de vida por medio de la mejora de las condiciones de la vivienda. Para ello ha tomado la decisión de comenzar a cambiar el techo y el crédito lo utilizará en la compra de materiales de construcción para dicha labor. Espera que el crédito le sea proporcionado sin dificultades y así salir adelante en su desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
José Manuel J. V. is an active worker with the Zamora Estrada Transport Company in San Rafael Del Sur. He works as a truck driver and has been with this company for one year. He is currently married, with five school-aged children. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used them to buy construction materials to improve the house where he lives. He is requesting the current loan to replace the roof of his house. The loans have benefited him greatly, since they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Quarry stone, sand, cement

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela, de 35 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de su hermana, su madre y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 15 años, trabaja en su casa, aplicando bordados en prendas para niños. Es así que va siempre a la fábrica a recoger docenas de retazos y telas en diversos colores y formas, material que le ayudará para confeccionar los diseños puestos sobre las prendas ya tejidas. Poco a poco les da forma a las figuras, ya sean geométricas o con motivos andinos, al final estas prendas son exportadas en el extranjero.  Le gusta el trabajo que realiza; ya que a la vez cuida de su hija, además cuando le dan menos tiempo para la entrega de sus bordados, pide apoyo a su madre y hermana, así logra cumplir a tiempo su trabajo. Lo que más anhela, es poner  su propio taller de chompas, para que toda su familia participe en el negocio.  Es su 21avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, puesto que sabe y valora lo beneficioso que es, y se siente contenta de trabajar con sus compañeras de grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará variedad de lana y telas, con el fin de cumplir con los  bordados y pueda captar más sus rentas.
texts.en:
Mariela, 35, lives in her parents’ house with her sister, her mother and her three children. For over 15 years she has worked at home attaching embroidery to children’s clothes. She goes to the factory to collect dozens of remnants and pieces of fabric in various colors and shapes that she uses to make the designs that are attached to items that are already woven. Gradually she gives them shape, be they geometric or Andean themed. At the end, these items are. She enjoys the work she does because she can care for her daughter while she works. Besides, when they only give her a short amount of time to finish the items she can call on her mother and sister to help so that she is able to finish on time. What she’d like the most is to establish her own sweater sewing workshop so that the entire family can participate in the business. This is her 21st loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all the installments on time because she knows the benefits of them and values them and feels very happy to collaborate with her fellow group members. She will use the requested funds to buy an assortment of fabrics and wool in order to complete the embroidery and earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an assortment of wool and fabric.

loans.name: Kaïraba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de de solidarité KAÏRABA est né depuis le premier cycle du Banc Villageois en Mars 2001. Le groupe est composé de 09 femmes de différents ages, qui habitent le même quartier. Elles mènent des activités telles que la production de savon, le petit commerce et le maraichage. Elles ont un bon niveau d'épargne. Avec les revenus qu'elles gagnent elles soutiennent leurs maris dans les charges de la famille que sont la nourriture, la santé, la scolarité des enfants et l'habillement. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KADIOR

Madame AWA B., assise en deuxième position à partir de la droite sur la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe  verte foncée est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 69 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfant mais a la charge de 5 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle est transformatrice de savon. C'est avec le soutien de ses enfants en garde que l'huile est transformé en savon et vendu dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité

Avec son crédit elle achète des futs d'huile pour la fabrique du savon.

Son objectif est de croître ses revenus afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels et mieux prendre en charge les enfants qui lui sont confiés.
texts.en:
The KAÏRABA solidarity group was created in March 2001 at the first cycle of the Banc Villageois of KADIOR, to which it belongs. The group consists of nine (9) women of varying ages living in the same neighborhood. They carry on activities such as soap making, petty trade and market gardening. They sustain a good level of savings. With the income they earn, they help their husbands with family expenses such as food, healthcare, children’s tuition, and clothing. Mrs. AWA B., sitting second from the right in the photo and wrapped in a dark green scarf, is the head of the group. She is a 69-year-old widow with no children but takes care of five (5) children entrusted to her by relatives. She is a soap maker. With the children’s help, she processes the oil into soap, which she then sells at the local weekly markets. With her loan, she will buy barrels of oil to be used in soap making. Her goal is to bolster her income in order to meet her personal needs and better provide for the children in her care.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her business

loans.name: Roque Plutarco

texts.es: El Sr. Roque Plutarco D. H. es trabajador activo de la  Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del sur tiene  cinco  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Electricista. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Roque Plutarco D. H. is an active worker for the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. He has worked for this institution for five years, in the position of Electrician. He has had five loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used all of them to buy construction materials and improve the house where he lives. The loans have benefited him greatly, because they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beams and metal sheets, and paying for labor

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: L. señora Hilda tiene 35 años D. edad y vive en Huaycán, tiene en su cargo a 3 hijos y es conviviente. ElL. trabaja en L. venta D. ropas D. forma informal desD. hace 2 años y lleva 5 meses trabajando con Edaprospo, el ultimo préstamo le sirvió para comprar más prendas que vender, Hilda también trabaja en el Quiosco del colegio D. su hijo y espera poner su propia bodega en casa, ya que no hay alguna cerca, se encuentra feliz por L. ampliación y mejoramiento D. su casa y por su grupo “El Buen Samaritano” el cual es conformado por sus vecinos y el nombre fue elegido rememorando L. posta médica que se encuentra cerca y les ha ayudado con sus urgencias ocasionales D. salud.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 35, lives in Huaycán; she is in a common-law marriage and has three children in her care. She has been selling clothing for two years and has been working with Edaprospo for five months; she used her last loan to increase her inventory of clothing. Hilda also works in a kiosk at her son's school, and she hopes to open her own grocery store in her home, given that currently there isn't one nearby. Hilda is very happy about the improvements and the build-out of her home, and she is grateful for her group "Good Samaritan" which is maD. up of her neighbors; the name of the group was chosen in honor of the nearby first-aid clinic which has helped them with health emergencies.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandize and raw materials

loans.name: Petronila Emilia

texts.es: La  Sra. Petronila Emilia L. C.  ella es Trabajadora del colegio público Farabundo Martí Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene veinte y cuatro  años de trabajar para el Magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene dos  niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Petronila Emilia L. C. is an employee of the Farabundo Martí Villa el Carmen public school where she works a primary school teacher; she has worked in education for twenty-four years. Petronila is married and has two school-age children. Petronila has had six loans with CEPRODEL which she used for the purchase of construction materials and for making improvements to her home. The CEPRODEL loans have been of great help to Petronila and have allowed her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sand, cement, gravel, stone

loans.name: Yadira De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira de los Ángeles S. es trabajadora activa del Colegio “Escuela Monte limar” San Rafael del Sur tiene  Veinte y cinco  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación primaria. Ha tenido  diez créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación, los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yadira de los Ángeles S. is an employee of the "Monte Limar" school located in San Rafael del Sur where she has worked for twenty-five years as a primary school teacher. Yadira has had ten loans with CEPRODEL all of which were used for the purchase of construction materials and making improvements to her home. The loans have been a great help to Yadira since they allowed her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sand, cement, gravel, construction labor

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carmelo; el tiene 34 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con la prestación de servicio de taxi, el socio tiene un automóvil y el trabaja todos los días de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. El socio necesita el dinero para hacerle el mantenimiento a su auto y cambiarle algunos repuestos. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su auto.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmelo belongs to the Virgen del Rosario del Cusco Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Carmelo is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He combines his daily activities with providing taxi service. He has an automobile, and he works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. He needs the money to provide maintenance to his vehicle and for some replacement parts. He is requesting the loan to invest in the maintenance of his automobile. He is grateful to the people who are part of this dream by providing the loan. He promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of his automobile

loans.name: Dimbal Diabote Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIMBAL DIABOTE est créé en mars 2001. Il est composé de 8 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame NIALING B., assise tout à fait à droite sur la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfant. Mais elle a la charge d'un enfants qu'elle a adopté.

Elle achète du pain de singe du sucre et des condiments pour fabriquer des jus de fruits naturels qu'elle vend dans son quartier et environs.

Avec son crédit elle va Augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'intensifier sa production et réaliser plus de bénéfices.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Dimbal Diabote was formed in March 2001. It is made up of 8 women, all from the same village, who have come together as friends and neighbors. Mrs. Nialang B., seated, at the right of the photo, wearing a scarf, is the group's leader. She is a widow, and has no children, but is responsible for one child, whom she adopted. She buys baobab fruit (also known as "monkey bread"), sugar and condiments to make natural fruit juices which she sells in her neighborhood and the surrounding area. With her loan, she will increase the level of her supplies, so that production can go up and she can make more income. Mrs. B.'s goal is to add to her savings and meet her personal needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop a small business selling natural fruit juice

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Omar Antonio G. L. él es Trabajador de la Empresa Enacal desempeñándose como fontanero tiene  siete años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente tiene dos niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Omar Antonio G. L. works for the Enacal company, as a plumber. He has worked for this company for seven years. He is currently married and has two school-aged children. He has had eight loans with CEPRODEL and has used all of them to buy construction materials and improve the house where he lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him greatly, since they have allowed him to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, cement, stone and stone blocks

loans.name: Lesvia María

texts.es: La Sra. Lesvia María T. C. ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como ama de llaves tiene  seis años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lesvia María T. C. works for the Barceló Hotel in Montelimar, as a housekeeping supervisor. She has worked for this company for six years. She is currently married. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL, and she has used all of them to buy construction materials and improve the house where she lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sand, cement, stone and stone blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cement, sand and stone blocks

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
El señor José Elías M.    tiene 5 años de dedicarse al desarrollo de ternero pero a partir del año 2008 se dedica a compra y venta de frijoles en la comarca de sálales   El Sauce. Además que tiene un negocio ya estable de 2 molino donde ofrece su servicio a la población en general.
EL está solicitando este crédito para la compra y venta de frijoles  lo que  venderá a un mejor precio  así obtener  mayores ingreso y  abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José Elías M. has 5 years of experience raising calves. However, starting in 2008, he has worked buying and selling beans in the district of Sálales, in El Sauce. He also has a steady business with 2 mills, where he offers his services to the general population. He is requesting this loan to buy beans to sell. He will sell them at a better price and thus obtain more income so he can cover the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 22 quintals of beans

loans.name: Aidee Maricela

texts.es:
Aidee de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. Tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Hace unos años atrás comenzó con su tienda de ropa vendiendo ropa de niño ya que por su sector no había, poco a poco con esfuerzo y la motivación de mantener a sus tres hijos invirtió sus ahorros en ropa y vitrinas, ahora tiene su pequeña tienda de ropa en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y bisutería y así surtir mejor el local. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle un mejor financiamiento a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aidee, 25, lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso, Guayaquil, an area noted for its hilly streets. She has a small clothing store in the front part of her house. A few years back she started with her clothing store selling children’s clothes that were unavailable around her neighborhood. Gradually with much effort and needing to support her three children she invested her savings in clothes and display cases. Now she has her small clothing store in the front part of her house. She needs a loan to buy clothes and costume jewelry to better stock her store. In the future she’d like to finish building her house and provide better income for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Venus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Venus está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras  una de ellas es Christian Argentina S. M. quien hace cuatro años inicio con la venta de comida junto con su madre y por medio de los préstamos invirtió en hamburguesas y licor negocio en el que le va muy bien. 

Esta joven de 22 años  tiene la meta aumentar su negocio por lo cual con el crédito piensa surtir especialmente en licor y estudiar secretariado.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ligia del Socorro P. P. comerciante de prendas, Nuejara María G. Berrio  vende ropa desde hace dos años y Margarita de Jesús M. distribuidora de productos Avon, Romamel, Safiro y Arabela.
texts.en:
The Venus Group is comprised of four working women. One of them is Christian Argentina S. Mendoz who began selling food four years ago with her mother. With the help of loans that they invested in hamburgers and liquor, their liquor business is doing very well. 22-year-old Christian’s goal is to increase their business by using the loan to purchase liquor and to support her studies to become a secretary. The other members of the group are Ligia del Socorro P. P., clothing merchant, Nuejara María G. Berrio, clothing seller for two years, and Margarita de Jesús M., distributor for cosmetics such as Avon, Romamel, Safiro, and Arabela.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase liquor

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro 2 & 9 Group

texts.en:
Eladia is the coordinator of her group Trabajando para el Futuro 2 & 9. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own house built with concrete blocks. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy her current home.

Eladia is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for more than 6 years after she started selling at home, while her husband was fishing. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying all kinds of seafood (octopus, fish, squid, etc). She will use the profits from her business to buy school supplies. She also needs to buy a dining table and and a vehicle to transport the merchandise.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed the loans for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy seafood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic supplies to start his store

loans.name: Sabrina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sabrina está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ruth Ileana Gutiérrez Roberto propietaria de un pequeño kiosco donde comercializa desde gaseosa, chiverías y cigarro, además vende perfumes y cremas desde hace 12 años.  Ella con el crédito invertirá en la realización de comida y la compra de mercadería en perfumes y cremas.

Las otras integrantes de son Elena María C. G. tiene una pequeña pulpería y vende ropa  y   Estela del Socorro R. propietaria de un modesto comedor desde hace 17 años.
texts.en:
The Sabrina Group consists of three hard-working and enterprising women. One of them is Ruth Ileana Gutiérrez Roberto, owner of a small kiosk. For 12 years, Ruth has been selling sodas, yogurts, cigars, perfumes, and creams. She will buy food and perfumes and creams with the loan. The other members of the group are Elena María C. G., who has a small grocery store and sells clothing, and Estela del Socorro R., who owns a modest food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc. and perfumes and creams

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 2 Group

texts.en:
Andrea is the coordinator of her group, Ruth y Esther 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a stable business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying work.

Andrea is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years, starting with selling underwear. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying shoes, accessories, underwear and an exhibitor. She will use the profits to buy school supplies, to invest in more products, and she is planning to buy a computer. She also wants to have telephone service and to have a store with all kinds of merchandise.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed the loan for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear and shoes

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia, a lado de sus 2 hijos  jóvenes, que trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Esta laboriosa dama se dedica a la comercialización de anticuchos (platillo peruano compuesto de corazón de res a la parrilla) en la esquina de una calle aledaña a su casa. La venta es diaria, y su labor empieza desde muy temprano cuando compra la carne que untará con especias, ya luego ensarta las carnes con palitos, para luego freírlas a la parrilla. Su platillos son bien buscados, por la sazón que tiene, luego que sus clientes prueban sus ricos anticuchos se van satisfechos. Asegura que es un negocio bastante rentable, pues obtiene ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente, y le gusta dedicarse a la preparación de anticuchos, ya que es un negocio bastante tranquilo. Y como a Sofía le gusta trabajar, para salir adelante, pues tiene planeado ampliar su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, además manifiesta que esta muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo porque todos los integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Sofía tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de un carrito sanguchero (especial para frituras) y también mesas y sillas, para ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sofia is 60 and she lives in her own house with her two children who work and help her with the household expenses. She is a hardworking woman who sells anticuchos (a typical Peruvian dish of grilled beef heart) on the corner of a street by her house. She sells every day and the work begins very early when she buys the meat to rub in the spices. She then spears the meat with sticks and then fries it on the grill. Her food is very sought after for the flavor that it has. When her customers try her delicious anticuchos they are satisfied. She maintains that this is a profitable business since the earnings help her live comfortably. She likes to make the anticuchos because it is a very stable business. And since Sofia likes to work to get ahead, she plans on enlarging her business to offer better service to her customers. This is the fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make all the payments punctually. She also shows that she is very happy with the work of her group because all the members are very responsible and supportive. Sofia plans on using the loan to buy a “carrito sanguchero” (a special cart for frying) and also tables and chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart for frying, as well as tables and chairs to set up her food stall

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Señor Sergio S. O. tiene 37 años, el está separado de su esposa  y es padre de dos hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, el trabaja en el magisterio  como profesor de primaria, él también trabaja como moto taxista en el sindicato “CARRASCO”  en el cual esta hace mas de 10 años como socio activo y pertenece al directorio del mencionado Sindicato, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

El cliente ya conoce bien de créditos, es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuentemente mejorar su calidad de vida.
Cabe señalar que el señor Sergio S. O. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Sergio is 37 years old, separated from his wife and is the father of two children, whom he helps and supports with their education. He works as a elementary-school teacher and also drives a moto-taxi as a member of the "Carrasco" labor union. He has been an active member for more than 10 years and is on the union's directory. His taxi service is lucrative because of the high number of people who require the service due to its ease, speed and efficiency. The union has stops and shifts for each member in different points throughout the town of Ivirgarzama, where people use the taxi service. Sergio already is quite familiar with loans, but this is the first time he has taken one out with this institution. He plans to use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle because the one he currently has has run its course for his work. In this way he will be able to provide a better service to his customers, which will also help him increase his income and consequently improve his quality of life.
