It should be noted that Sergio came to Kiva partner CIDRE to request his loan after one of his co-workers commented to him about the institution's good credit conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Angelita Paulina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y la calidez de su gente. Se  reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo.

La señora Angelita lleva en el Banco Comunal 16 años dice que le gusta porque dan los créditos sin muchos tramites y los intereses son bajos.

Mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, es una ama de casa que se da tiempo para hacer muchas cosas,  ya que además de atender su hogar también estudia párvulo en la Universidad Eloy Alfaro de Manta los Sábados Y Domingos.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa el cual inicio con uno de los créditos de la Fundación Espoir hace 10 años. Además elabora muñecas las mismas que vende a sus compañeras de la Universidad. Vende ropa 3 días a la semana en Jipijapa su tierra natal. La mercadería la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá salen más baratas y le dejan mejores ganancias.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa de mujeres y ciertos productos para elaborar sus muñecas.7

Su sueño es ser una profesional y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich cultural and the quality of its people, members of the Community Bank Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo (With Love and Faith Toward Development) meet every 15 days. Angelita has been a member for the past 16 years and says she enjoys it because she gets the loan without many formalities and the interest rates are low. She lives with her partner and has two children. She is a housewife and spends her time doing many things because along with tending to her home she also is studying child care at the local university on Saturdays and Sundays. She has a business selling clothing, which she started with a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Espoir 10 years ago. She also makes dolls, which she sells to her classmates at the university. She sells clothing three days a week in Jipijapa, her hometown. She buys the merchandise in Guayaquil because it's cheaper there and gives her better profits. She plans to use this loan to purchase women's clothing as well as certain supplies to make her dolls. Her dream is to earn a degree and practice her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, fabric, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny, D. 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su esposo Ricardo D. 46 años y D. sus 3 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan en un barrio populoso ubicado al norte D. L. ciudad. Esta carismática mujer pasa los días cuidando D. su pequeño hijo que tiene 1 año, y también comparte su tiempo en L. atención D.  su negocio D. venta D. jugos, sándwiches y distintos platillos, ubicado en un pequeño mercado que colinda con L. parte trasera D. su casa. ElL. trabaja con L. ayuda D. su hermana mayor y con su hija, y dice que el negocio solo es algo tedioso desD. el mediodía hasta las 3 D. L. tarD., pues L. visitan varios comensales a L. misma vez y debe atenderlos a todos. Dice que las ganancias que obtiene, L. reparte entre elL. y su hermana, que juntas trabajan en busca del progreso. Como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones D. su negocio y así mejorar sus ganancias ya que calcuL. que L. visitarán más clientes. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y promete que será puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas, ya que sabe que solo así podrá retribuir L. confianza D. todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño D. su grupo pues todos los integrantes son responsables. Yenny tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en L. compra D. mayor cantidad D. mercadería D. comestibles para surtir mejor su negocio, D. esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yenny is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Ricardo, 46, and their three small children. They live in a populated neighborhood north of the city. This charismatic woman spends her days caring for her 1-year-old son as well as tending to her business selling juices, sandwiches and distinct meals out of a small market adjacent to the back of her home. She works with the help of her eldest sister and her daughter, and says that the business is only tedious between noon and 3 p.m., because various customers come at the same time and she has to tend to all of them. She says that she shares the profits with her sister, and they work together in search of progress. As a businesswoman she is planning to make improvements to her business in the future and thus increase her profits since she figures more customers will visit. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments since she knows that is the only way she will be able to repay the confidence of all the people who maD. this loan possible, allowing her to continue working. Furthermore, she is very satisfied with the performance of her group because all the members are responsible. With the loan she is requesting, Yenny is planning to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of food products to better stock her business, and in this way she hopes to keep making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products to better stock her business

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
El Señor Macario A. S. tiene 27 años es soltero y  tiene 2 hijos; el trabaja actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es  la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuentemente mejorar su calidad de vida.
El señor Macario A. S. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución, el tiene la vision de poder hacer estudiar a sus hijos, pues despues de la migracion de la madre de sus hijos a España, ellos quedaron casi desamparados.
texts.en:
Sr. Macario A. S. is 27 years old, single, and has two children. He currently works as a motorcycle taxi driver for the August 2nd union, of which he has been an active member for more than three years. His business is profitable because of the high quality of customers who request his service since it is convenient, quick, and efficient. The union assigns stops and routes for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama where people go out of their way to request taxi services.

This is the first time Macario is requesting a loan from CIDRE. He plans to buy a new motorcycle so that he can perform his work and provide better service to his customers. As a result, his income will improve as well as his quality of life.

Sr. Macario A. S. applied for a loan from CIDRE after his co-workers told him about the good credit terms one can receive by working with the Institution. He has the vision to provide his children with an education since they were left almost helpless after their mother migrated to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
En los Bajos de Montecristi lugar de gente honesta y trabajadoras dedicadas a labores del campo y artesanía se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo.

Aquí dialogamos con la señora Lorena R., está casada y tiene seis hijos tres varones y tres mujeres. Es una ama de casa que comparte su tiempo entre su casa  y su negocio. 

Ella junto y su esposo tienen un puesto de venta de verduras en el mercado de Tarqui en Manta. Trabajan tres días a la semana los días lunes, jueves y sábados desde las 5 am. hasta  las dos o tres dependiendo de las ventas. Dice  que su esposo compra los productos en Portoviejo por que salen más baratos.

Este crédito lo va  invertir en comprar verduras legumbres y en especial frejol de palo que es un tipo de frejol muy apetecido por los clientes y que se vende a buen precio por ser de temporada (una vez al año).

Estuvo en el Banco Comunal en sus inicios luego se retiro y regreso de nuevo hace 5 años, le encantan las charlas educativas de la Fundación Espoir.

Su sueño es tener una gran  tienda.
texts.en:
Bajos de Montecristi is a place known for its honest and hardworking people who make their living by farming and making handicrafts. This is where the members of the Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) gather every fifteen days to conduct their meetings.

This profile will focus on Sra. Lorena R.. She is married and has six children, three boys and three girls. Lorena is a homemaker who divides her time between her home and her business.

She and her husband have a vending stall at the Tarqui Market in Manta where they sell vegetables. Lorena works three days each week – Mondays, Thursdays, and Saturdays – starting at 5am until 2 or 3pm depending on her sales. She says her husband buys the products in Portoviejo because they are cheaper over there.

This loan will be used to buy legumes and a special type of dried bean that is very popular among her customers. She sells them at a great price since they are only available on a seasonal basis (once a year).

Lorena was a member of the Communal Bank when it started but then left the group. She returned five years ago and enjoys the educational seminars provided by Fundación ESPOIR. Her dream is to open a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of legumes

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 62 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo José de 65 años y de sus 4 hijos mayores, de los cuales 2 son casados, pero aun viven con ella. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y accesorios de una reconocida marca, desde hace 1 año, recuerda como al principio, como en  todo negocio no fue nada fácil empezar. Ahora luego de algunos meses tiene regulares ganancias pues sus clientes que son fijas le hacen pedidos con regular frecuencia y le pagan a crédito, pero le gusta porque son puntuales. Lo que no le gusta es captar nuevas clientes, pues muchas veces ha pasado que no le cumplían en el pago, y eso le ocasionaba grandes pérdidas. Pero aun así no perdió la esperanza de continuar en la comercialización de productos por catalogo, con mayor esmero y dedicación para mejorar sus ganancias. Paralelamente a este negocio también se dedica a la compra y venta de productos al por mayor en provincias del Perú, en este negocio trabaja en sociedad con su nuera y dice que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Dina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería de productos de belleza para mantenerlos en stock cuando una de sus clientas requiera algo.
texts.en:
Dina is 62 years old and lives in her own home with her husband José, age 65, and their four grown children. Two of her children are married even though they still live with her. Dina earns her living by selling beauty products and accessories of a well-known brand for the past year. She remembers that her business was difficult to get established at first. Now she generates a steady stream of income from her regular customers who place orders with her on a frequent basis. She extends credit to her customers and likes those occasions when they pay on time. What she does not enjoy is having to attract new customers since there have been several instances when she did not get paid and accumulated heavy losses. In addition to this business, she buys and sells products in bulk in other provinces of Peru with the help of her daughter-in-law. She says the income she generates from her businesses helps her to live comfortably.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Dina promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan she requested in a large purchase of beauty products to maintain her inventory for whenever one of her customers needs anything.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to restock her inventory

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Carlos Gonzales Terrazas tiene 25 años, vive en Ivirgarzama toda su vida, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. Vive con la mama de su hijo aunque aun no se casaron. 

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, para poder realizar sus trabajos de mototaxista y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente así mejorar su calidad de vida, poderles dar mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo y su mamá. Quienes no tienen culpa alguna de la crisis económica.

El señor Juan Carlos S. L. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo pues tiene la visión de poder mejor su calidad de vida solicitando un crédito para adquirir una motocicleta nueva.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos S. L. is 25 years old and has lived in Ivirgarzama all his life. He is single and has one child. Juan Carlos currently works as a motorcycle taxi driver for the August 2nd union and has been an active member for more than three years. His business is profitable because of the high quality of customers who request his service since it is convenient, quick, and efficient. He lives with the mother of his child but they are not yet married.

This is the first time Juan Carlos is requesting a loan from CIDRE. He plans to buy a new motorcycle so that he can perform his work and provide better service to his customers. As a result, his income will improve as well as his quality of life. This will provide better living conditions for his young son and his mother. They do not blame anyone for the economic crisis.

Sr. Juan Carlos S. L. applied in person for a loan from CIDRE because he has the vision to improve his quality of life. He is requesting a loan to acquire a new motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 51 años, vive en casa de su hermano en compañía de su 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son mayores, y  juntos habitan un barrio populoso al norte de la ciudad. Hace más de 14 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca. Dice que empezó en el negocio como jugando, ya pasaron varios años, y en la actualidad  no solo obtiene buenas ganancias por sus ventas, si no también, por captar nuevos clientes y vendedoras para que ofrezcan la marca. Lo que más le gusta de su empleo es ofrecer los variados productos y recomendar a sus compradoras los cosméticos que mejor le quedan; pero afirma que no le gusta caminar mucho en busca de nuevas clientes, pero los incentivos que recibe de la empresa la motivan bastante. Para ella su labor  es tranquila y obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Mas adelante tiene planeado aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, pues desea mejorar sus ganancias. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete una vez más, como en anteriores oportunidades ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas; pues desea continuar trabajando en busca del progreso; además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza, perfumes, además de accesorios pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir, de esta manera espera ganar más.
texts.en:
María, age 51, lives in her brother's house in the company of her 4 children, of whom 2 are already adults. Together, they live in a densely populated neighborhood in the north of the city. For more than 14 years, she has worked selling a well-known brand of beauty products. She says she began the business just for fun, and then several years passed, and currently she not only obtains good profits from her sales, but also is able to attract new clients and sellers to offer the brand. What she likes most about her job is offering a variety of products and recommending the cosmetics that best suit her customers. She reports that she does not like walking a lot in search of new customers, but the incentives she receives from the company are very motivating for her. She finds the work pleasant, and she obtains a steady income which allows her to live comfortably. In the future, she plans to increase the number of products she offers to her customers, since she would like to increase her earnings. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and once again she promises, as in previous opportunities, to be punctual in making her payments, since she wants to continue working in her quest to get ahead. In addition, she is very grateful to all of those people who made the loan possible. María plans to invest the loan she is requesting in buying a larger quantity of merchandise, including beauty products and perfumes, in addition to accessories, since she has a number of pending orders to fill. In this way, she hopes to earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking more beauty products so she can fill her pending orders

loans.name: Zolonides

texts.es: Zolonides, de 53 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su joven hija Mónica de 20 años, juntos habitan en una modesta morada, ubicada en un barrio populoso al norte de la ciudad. Cada día es una lucha constante por salir adelante para este trabajador hombre que se dedica desde hace 10 años a prestar el servicio de taxi, que realiza  por diferentes calles de la ciudad. Dice que la labor es tranquila, pues se entretiene bastante conversando con sus casuales pasajeros, aunque prefiere trabajar durante el horario de día pues  sabe que taxear en las noches resulta algo peligroso, además a él le gusta dormir sus horas. Hace algunos años  se separó de su pareja y desde entonces trabaja junto a su hija en busca del progreso. Además asegura que su trabajo le genera ganancias regulares debido a que ya tiene pasajeros fijos que lo llaman con frecuencia para que los movilice. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar otro auto para brindarlo en alquiler y así generarse mejores ganancias. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza que depositaron en él las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá progresar. Zolonides tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en cambiarle algunas piezas a su vehiculo ya que requiere algo de mantenimiento, además destinará una parte en la refacción a una pieza de su casa, de esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zolonides, 53, lives in his own home with his young daughter, Mónica, 20. They live together in a modest home located in a crowded neighborhood in the north part of the city. Every day is a constant struggle to get ahead for this hard working man who has been a taxi driver for the last 10 years providing transportation services throughout the city. He says the work is easygoing because he distracts himself quite a bit chatting with his fares although he prefers to work during the daytime because being a taxi driver at night can be dangerous. Besides, he likes to sleep at his regular times. A few years ago he was separated and since then he and his daughter work together seeking progress. He assures us that his work generates steady income because he already has regular customers that call him frequently when they need transportation. Because he is quite an enterprising man he plans to buy another car in the future and lease it out to generate better profits. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay punctually because he doesn’t want to disappoint those who placed their trust in him and made funds available for him to continue progressing. Zolonides plans to use the requested funds to change a few parts on his car that need maintenance. He will use part of the funds to refurbish one of the rooms in his house thus improving his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his car.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 52 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Orlando de 57 años y de sus 2 hijos mayores e independientes. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica, desde hace 12 años, a la venta de especerías en un puesto que tiene en un mercado ubicado en un distrito populoso de la ciudad. Le gusta su trabajo, pues lo realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, además sabe preparar con buena sazón sus especerías y por eso tiene clientes fijos que no dudan de la calidad de sus comestibles, es por eso que obtiene regulares ganancias de sus ventas. Desde hace 1 año instaló, junto a su familia, una pequeña empresa de confección de ropa en material pyma. Ofrece su producción en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad, se siente satisfecha, pues este negocio familiar también le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. En adelante tiene planeado ampliar el negocio de confección de ropa y así esperar continuar progresando. Es el sétimo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntual sus cuotas, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Elena tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes para seguir preparando sus especerías, además también destinará una parte en la compra de material para continuar confeccionando la ropa, pues junto a su familia ya patentaron su propia marca.
texts.en:
Elena, 52, lives in her own house with her husband Orlando, 57, and their two adult children. For 12 years, this enterprising woman has sold spices at a stand she has at a market located in a highly populated area of the city. She likes her work, which she does from 8 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. She also knows how to prepare good-tasting spices, and for this reason she has regular customers who do not doubt the quality of her products. This is why she has regular earnings from her sales. One year ago, together with her family, she started a company making cotton clothing. She sells her clothing at a large emporium in the city. Elena is satisfied since this family business gives her a regular income that allows them to live comfortably. In the future she plans to expand the clothing business and hopes to continue making progress. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually since she is very grateful to all the people who made possible the loan that will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Elena plans to invest the requested loan in purchasing ingredients in bulk to continue making her spices. She will also set aside part of the loan for buying material to continue making clothing since, together with her family, they have already established their own brand.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar ingredientes para preparar especerias.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, D. 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía D. su esposo Rubén D. 48 años y D. sus 3 hijos que son mayores D. edad. Cuando su hija mayor decidió instalar en su casa el servicio D. alquiler D. cabinas para ofrecer el servicio D. Internet, ella vio  la oportunidad D. empezar a ofrecer golosinas y gaseosas en ese negocio, para así generarse ingresos extras. Tiempo después comenta que le esta yendo muy bien, además se turna en el horario D. atención con su hija, luego  se reparten las ganancias regulares que se obtienen del negocio. Además le gusta mucho este trabajo  porque es tranquilo y lo realiza  en la comodidad D. su hogar. Como si fuera poco, también se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo D. una reconocida marca mundial, pero solo les venD. a sus amigas y conocidas. Además tiene muchos planes por concretar para el futuro, es por esta razón que tiene pensado instalar una pequeña tienda, junto al negocio D. su hija. Es el sétimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luz tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. gaseosas y golosinas para implementar mejor el negocio que tiene en las cabinas D. Internet D. su hija, D. esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz, 41, lives in her own house with her husband Rubén, 48, and their three adult children. When her older daughter decided to set up rental booths in her house to offer Internet service, Luz saw the opportunity to begin offering snacks and soft drinks at that business to generate some extra income. Some time later she says that it is going very well for her. She also alternates shifts with her daughter, and they diviD. the regular earnings that they obtain from the business. She also likes this work very much because it is peaceful, and she carries it out in the comfort of her home. As if that were not enough, she sells beauty products by catalog from a globally recognized brand, but she only sells them to her friends and neighbors. She also has many plans to settle for the future. For this reason she is thinking of installing a small shop next to her daughter's business. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually. She is also very grateful to all the people who maD. possible the loan that allows her to continue working in search of progress. Luz plans to invest the requested loan to buy more soft drinks and snacks to better stock the business that she has at her daughter's Internet booths. In this way she hopes to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and snacks to stock her business

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Fabian; el tiene 49 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con la artesanía, El socio trabaja junto a su hermano elaborando vasijas de arcilla, vasos, tazas, adornos en general y utensilios de uso doméstico. El socio desea invertir en la compra de insumos para seguir elaborando al por mayor y en un futuro cercano el socio desea exportar al extranjero todo su trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su taller de artesanía. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fabian is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de la O”, which is located in the District of Yucay in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Fabian divides his time between his daily activities and making handicrafts. He and his brother work together by making clay vessels, cups, bowls, general decorations, and household utensils. Fabian wants to invest in supplies so that he can continue producing in large quantities. In the near future, he wants to export all of his products to be sold abroad. He is requesting a loan to invest in his craft shop.

Fabian is grateful to everyone who helped him fulfill this dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his craft shop

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es: Patrocinia, de 43 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen cuatro hijos. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Patrocinia es una persona de mucho empuje y optimista, ya que para ella no existe la palabra “no se puede”, desde un principio se tuvo mucha confianza en expender su comida hacia el publico en general, desde luego que no lo pareció fácil de conseguir un sitio estratégico en donde pueda ofrecer sus platos típicos de su zona, pero con mucha perseverancia pudo concretar un lugar, en donde trabaja ahora de forma tranquila. Durante sus primeros seis meses ya estaba posicionado su negocio, en efecto se siente muy contenta por lo buenos momentos que viene atravesando, además de percibir buenas ganancias económicas. Por tal motivo desea mas adelante tener su propio local, para que de esa forma no incomode el libre flujo del transito. Por lo general su producto los vende de forma ambulatoria, en un barrio muy céntrico, y trabaja por cuenta propia y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además agradece a dicha institución por darle ese respaldo incondicional, ya que ello permitirá mejorar su negocio de venta de comida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra carnes, verduras, aceites, ingredientes, con la finalidad de que pueda elaborar sus deliciosos platos y de esa forma pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Patrocinia is 43 years old and lives with her partner and their four children. She has her own home made of wood in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful tropical jungles of Peru. Patrocinia is someone who has great drive and optimism because the phrase “I can’t” is not in her vocabulary. At first she did not have much confidence selling her food to the general public and then she had difficulty finding a strategic location where she could offer her local traditional dishes. With great perseverance, she was able to secure a place where she now works peacefully. Patrocinia was able to position her business within the first six months and is very happy because it is doing well at the moment and generating good revenues. Sometime later she would like to have her own shop so that she is not in the middle of all the traffic flow. She generally sells her products as a street vendor in one of the central neighborhoods. Patrocinia works by herself and has a daily routine that starts at 6am and ends at 9pm.

This is her first loan from MFP. Patrocinia promises to complete her payments in a timely manner. In addition, she thanks MFP for providing her with unconditional support since it will allow her to improve her food business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy meat, vegetables, oil, and other ingredients so that she can prepare her delicious dishes and satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto, de 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene cinco hijos en su haber. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Desde muy joven, Sixto se percató que el producto de cacao, tenía mucha demanda en el mercado, por ello decidió trabajar en la chacra de sus padres, desde luego que le gustaba vivir en el campo, ya que respira armonía y paz, durante un buen tiempo estuvo aplicado removiendo la tierra, sembrando y cosechando el producto de cacao que producían sus padres. Hoy produce y comercializa cacao a los grandes mayoristas, desde luego que hace un reconocimiento a sus padres, por las buenas lecciones que le brindaron, fruto de esa enseñanza tuvo buenos resultados económicos, ya que él aplica técnicas en el cuidado de sus plantaciones, por el cual sus clientes recurrentes están mas que satisfecho con el producto de cacao que ofrece. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su querida esposa y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita  de peones con la finalidad de que puedan extraer el fruto de forma eficiente y oportuna. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y los vende a un precio incomparable, para ello trabaja de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. En el futuro Sixto anhela construir su casa a base de material noble con la necesidad de que los pueda brindarle estabilidad y seguridad a su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando, tal como lo hizo en anteriores préstamos, además satisfecho con la institución, ya que lo brinda demasiado facilidades. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en el mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, para que de esa manera no disminuya su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Sixto is 44 years old, married, and has five children. They live together in the town of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house made of wood. Since he was very young, Sixto realized that there was a great deal of market demand for cocoa. For this reason, he decided to work on his parents' ranch. Of course he enjoyed living in the countryside, where you can breath harmony and peace. For a while, he applied himself to tending the land, planting and harvesting the cocoa produced by his parents. Today he produces and sells cocoa to the large wholesalers, as his parents have recognized the good lessons he has offered them. He uses techniques in care of his fields, so that his repeat customers are very satisfied with the cocoa product he offers. In general, he works with his beloved wife and together they make a good working team. However, during harvest season, he needs laborers in order to harvest the fruit in an efficient and timely manner. He makes his sales in the gathering centers of his town, and he sells at an unmatched price. To do so, he works from 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. In the future, Sixto longs to build his house from more solid materials, so that he can offer stability and security to his family. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he promises to continue to make repayments, as he has with his previous loans. He is also satisfied with the organization, which offers him good opportunities. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to invest in the adequate maintenance of his cocoa fields, so that his agricultural production will not decrease.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain his farmland, in order to achieve better cocoa production

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka F. is 33 and married with a child.  She plants and harvests taro for sale. Maka has many years of experience in this business.  

Maka needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan talas to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or about $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Maka joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Maka's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. El cultivo de la arveja, papa y maíz es la actividad a la que se dedica Abraham, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de la plaga de insectos que afecta sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más y así tener una mejor producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más semillas de arveja, para ampliar sus actuales sembríos.
texts.en:
Abraham is 22 years old, a simple, hard-working man. He lives with his parents, and his greatest desire is to get ahead in life. Abraham grows peas, potatoes, and corn, leaving the house early every day to work in his fields. His only goal is to strive so that his crops will be good. What he likes most about his job is caring for his land. He has done this work for 6 years, and finds that the hardest part is protecting his land from infestation by the insects attracted to his crops. In time, he hopes to sow more and thus have higher production. This is his first loan with MFP. He is aware that he must pay the installments punctually if he is to secure another loan. He is a responsible, active member of his communal bank. With the six hundred new soles he is requesting, he will buy seeds for peas, to add to what he has already sown.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: Alina

texts.es: Alina, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de su mamá junto a su esposo Diego de 24 años y sus dos queridos hijos Sarai de 6 y Cristopher de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En los verdes campos del poblado de Huaracayo (Distrito de la provincia de Tarma), Alina tiene sus cultivos de papa y arveja, todas las mañanas sin importarle las condiciones del clima sale a trabajar sus tierras, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 15 años de experiencia y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Alina, a very sincere and industrious woman of 30 years old, lives in her mother’s house with her husband, Diego of 24 years and their two beloved children, Sarai of 6 years and Cristopher, aged 2. The children are their reason for being. In the green fields of the town of Huaracay (District of the Tarma Province), Alina works her potato and pea plots every morning irrespective of the day’s weather. Alina provides the family with its only source of income. Alina loves tilling the land and has been doing so for 15 years. Alina believes that protecting crops from insect infestation is the hardest part of the job. As time goes on, she would like to purchase more land in order to increase production. This is Alina’a first loan with MFP and she is saving in order to be able to make timely repayments, as she does not want to cause problems for the communal group of which she feels very happy to be a part. With the loan amount of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian Soles), Alina plans to buy more fertilisers.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilisers for crops.

loans.name: Siulepa

texts.en:
Siulepa S. is 48 and married with eight children. Her business is selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Siulepa has many years of experience in this business.  

Siulepa needs a loan of 1500 Samoan talas to buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or about $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Siulepa joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Siulepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags

loans.name: Sonia Juana

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela Comercio de la Ciudad de Portoviejo conocida tradicionalmente como la Ciudad del Valle, allí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Sonia ella es separada y tiene cinco hijos menores de edad, es una mujer muy activa que le gusta trabajar en lo que sea con tal de sacar a sus hijos adelante.  Ella prepara y vende natilla (dulce muy delicioso), leche de soya, también vende ropa por catalogo, productos de AVON (revista de accesorios de belleza, perfumes, etc) y también vende recipientes de plástico, dice que este es un producto muy bueno y que le deja muy buenas ganancias.

Comparte su tiempo entre su casa y su trabajo por que según ella es padre y madre a la vez, pero esto no le molesta por que como dice ella gracias a Dios y a su trabajo no le falta nada.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y otros productos para la elaboración de la natilla.
 
Es el tercer ciclo con la fundación Espoir  y esta muy contenta, desea comprar un carro para llevar a sus hijos a la escuela y repartir sus pedidos.
texts.en:
In the shopping district of the town of Portoviejo, known traditionally as Ciudad del Valle (City of the Valley), the Community Bank Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas (Successful Women United) come together every 15 days. It is here that we meet Sonia who is separated and has five children. She is a very active woman and works hard to give her kids the best chance in life. Sonia prepares and sells natilla (a delicious caramelised dish), soya milk, and clothes ordered through a catalogue. She also sells Avon cosmetic products (through a beauty and perfume catalogue), and tupperware, which she says is of very good quality and reaps very good financial rewards. Sonia divides her time between her house and her work, which, according to Sonia, makes her a mother and father at the same time! But, Sonia does not mind this as she says it is thanks to God that she has her job and does not want for anything. This new loan will be used to buy clothes and other products for making natilla. This is Sonia’s third loan with the Espoir foundation of which she is very happy to be a part. Sonia would like to buy a car to be able to take her children to school and carry out deliveries.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trousers/pants, blouses, shirts, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Vii

texts.en:
Vii T. is 74 and married with 10 children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. Vii has four years of experience in this business  and  needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

Vii joined SPBD in 2008 and this is her third loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
La   Sra. Elba Rosa Dávila, trabaja de lunes a domingo de las 8 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde en su negocio venta de ropa, ella vende ambulante y la fritanga los fines de semana de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche.
Es madre de familia de tres hijos y dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar.
El préstamo otorgado es para la compra de mercadería para invertir en su negocio.
Ha trabajado con ceprodel seis préstamos y estos han sido para la compra de mercadería a hora cuenta con un negocio más solido y podrá competir con la competencia.
texts.en:
Elba Rosa Dávila works from Monday through Sunday, from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening, in her business selling clothes. She sells them on a mobile basis, and she also sells fried foods on weekends, from 5 in the evening until 9 at night. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are of school age. The loan granted to her is for buying merchandise to invest in her business. She has had six loans with CEPRODEL, which she has used to buy merchandise. Now, she has a more solid business and can hold her own with the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing as well as supplies for preparing fried foods

loans.name: Angela Margarita

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela Comercio de la Ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas.

La señora Ángela nos cuenta que está en el Banco desde sus inicios, está casada y tiene seis hijos, viven hace 10 años en una finca que es de un señor que vive en EEUU y que la dejo a su cuidado, allí ellos crían  ganado vacuno.

Se dedican a la venta de leche, queso manaba (producto típico de la región) ella elabora el queso por las tardes para que al otro día su marido lo entregue a sus clientes junto con la leche que llevan a vender, también a la compra y venta de ganado.

Ella trabaja dos horas al día en la preparación del queso y el las mañanas en repartir los productos, el resto del tiempo lo dedican al cuidado de la finca y a criar sus animalitos.

El dinero que van a recibir lo van a utilizar para comprar dos vacas para aumentar su producción.

Sus sueños son tener su casa propia para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
In the shopping district of the city of Portoviejo, the members of Community Bank Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas (Successful Women United) get together every 15 days. Ángela relates that she has been involved with the Bank since its founding. She is married with six children and for 10 years has lived on a farm owned by a man residing in the United States. Ángela looks after the farm in the man’s absence and raises dairy cows. The farm sells milk and Manaba cheese (typical from the region). Ángela makes the cheese in the afternoons so that her husband can deliver and sell the cheese and milk to his clients the following day. They also buy and sell cattle. Ángela works for two hours per day making cheese and in the mornings she delivers the products. The rest of the time is spent taking care of the farm and raising the livestock. The loan will be used to purchase two cows in order to increase production. Ángela’s dream is to own her own house for the benefit of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Miriam R. tiene un pequeño negocio en el barrio san Judas, ella sale a vender ambulante en los barrios a le daños del sector.
Ella esta casada tiene dos hijos a su cargo a un que estos ya son mayores de edad, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de su casa y tiene un hijo en la universidad.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería como. Ropa, calzado, perfume y bolsos ya que estos son encargos que a ella le han hecho sus clientes.
Miriam dice que todos los prestamos han sido para su negocio y este ha venido creciendo ya que ahora cuneta con mas clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miriam R. has a small business in the San Judas neighborhood. She goes out to sell door-to-door in the area's neighborhoods. She is married with two children both whom are of age. Her husband helps her with the household expenses and they have a child studying at the university. The loan is to buy merchandise like: clothing, shoes, perfume, and purses since this is what she sells to her customers. Miriam says that all the loans have been for her business and that her business has been growing since she has gotten more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, purfume, and purses.

loans.name: Melva Aidee

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela Comercio de la Ciudad de Portoviejo. Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas.

Nos sentamos a dialogar con la señora Melva, es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos, dos de los cuales viven con ella.

Dice que su vida ha sido muy difícil ya que no tiene casa propia, vive en una casa que le prestó su hermana, pero desde que ingreso al Banco  Comunal las cosas han ido cambiando. Cuando recibió el primer crédito puso un negocio de venta de pescado el mismo que lo sigue manteniendo.
 
Se levanta todos los días de madrugada para comprar el pescado fresco, “que es el mejor” después su hijo sale a recorrer el campo en una moto porque es allí donde se vende mejor. Su forma de venta es directa y compra lo necesario para que se venda todo ya que cuesta mucho mantener el producto en buen estado hasta el otro día.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar más pescado y un congelador para almacenarlo.

Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y un carro para salir a distribuir el pescado.
texts.en:
The Successful Mutually Supportive Women communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Ciudadela Comercio, Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos. We sat down to chat with Melva. She’s a single mother of five children, two of whom still live with her. She says that her life has been very difficult because she doesn’t own her own house; she lives in a house borrowed from her sister. But, since she joined the communal bank things have been changing. When she got her first loan she set up a business selling fish that she still runs. She gets up every day at dawn to buy fresh fish because “it’s the best.” Later her son goes out on a motorcycle to sell in the countryside because that’s where sales are best. She sells direct and buys only what will be able to sell completely because it is very difficult to keep this product in good condition from one day to the next. This new loan will be used to buy more fish and a freezer to store it in. Her dreams are to own her own house and a car to use to sell fish.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and a freezer.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica G. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene 27 años de laborar. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado dos créditos para mejora de vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de zinc, puerta y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Verónica G. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as an elementary school teacher at the Simeón Pereira school in El Sauce, where she has been working for 27 years. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years where they have granted her two loans for housing improvements. The loan requested is for the purchase of zinc, a door, and payment for man labor.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, a door, and payment for man labor.

loans.name: Magda Lesbia

texts.es: La señora Magda D. es muy trabajadora y se ha dedicado a buscar la manera de llevar el sustento a su hogar puesto que es madre de familia de dos niños  y estos se en encuentra en edad escolar. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de mercadería porque piensa montar un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y perfumes. Ella piensa que con este negocio mejorará sus condiciones y tendrá ingresos extras que le ayuden en el sustento de su hogar compuesto por sus hijos amados.
texts.en:
Magda D. López works as the boss of Office B at the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. She is the mother of two school-aged children. The loan requested is for the purchase of merchandise since she plans to start a small business selling clothing and perfume. .

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for a business

loans.name: Maristania Solanda

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela Comercio de la Ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas.

La señora Maristania es casada, fruto de esta relación tiene tres lindos niños que son su alegría de vivir y tiene un hogar muy bonito. Además de su familia también viven con ellos su hermano y su sobrino.

Su casa queda ubicada cerca de una cancha es así como hace 8 meses surgió la idea de poner un negocio de bebidas, en el cual vende desde gaseosas hasta bebidas alcohólicas, según nos cuenta lo que mas se vende es la cerveza y la pony malta(bebida energisante) y que desde que inicio le ha ido muy bien.

Atiende su negocio desde las cuatro pm. hasta las ocho pm. Hay semanas que trabaja todos los días pero que en otras desde el jueves hasta el domingo, esta muy a gusto porque gana su dinero, trabaja en su casa, y le queda tiempo para dedicarles a su familia.

Va a utilizar el nuevo crédito para comprar mesas y sillas  para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Lleva ya tres ciclos en el Banco  Comunal y sus sueños son seguir aquí y tener un gran bar.
texts.en:
The Successful Mutually Supportive Women Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Ciudadela Comercio neighborhood. Maristania is married and she has three lovely children who are her life’s joy; she has a very pretty home. Besides her family her brother and nephew also live with them. Her house is very near a sports field so about 8 months ago she got the idea to open a beverage business where she can sell everything from soft drinks to alcoholic beverages. According to her, what sells best is beer and Pony Malta (a non-alcoholic energy drink) and she has done well since she opened. She is open for business from 4pm until 8pm. There are weeks when she works every day and others when she only opens Thursdays through Sundays. She is very satisfied because she earns income, works from home and has time to spend with her family. She will use the new loan to buy tables and chairs to provide better customer service. She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and her dream is to continue her and have a great bar.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Emilia M. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene once años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el fin de mejorar su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, cemento y zinc para la construcción de una cocina.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia M. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as an elementary school teacher at the Simeón Pereira school in El Sauce, where she has been working for 11 years. This is the first loan that she is requesting at CEPRODEL with the objective of making housing improvements. The loan will be invested in the purchase of bricks, cement, and zinc to build a kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brick, cement, and zinc

loans.name: Darling Amparo

texts.es:
La  Sra. Darling C. H., Ella trabaja como  Conserje en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Es madre de familia de dos niños  y estos se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: piso, cemento, arena para poner el piso a su casa de habitación.
Darling dice que gracias a  los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel  ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Darling C. H. works as a custodian at the Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. She is the mother of two school-aged children.

The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials such as: flooring, cement, and sand to install a floor in the house where she lives.

Darling says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her house by repairing the floor in her home

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina F. is 55 and married with seven children. She owns a business catching and selling ocean fish. She has two years of experience in this business and needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $100 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Lolina joined SPBD in 2010 and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Lolina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta cliente es madre de familia de dos  niños  y estos se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para cubrir los gastos médicos de su mama ya que esta se encuentra en ferma.
Ella dice que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa.
texts.en:
This client is the mother of two school-aged children. The loan requested is to cover the medical expenses of her mother since she is sick. She says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses for her mother.

loans.name: Yerlin José

texts.es: El Sr. Yerlin M. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  dos años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado dos créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para resolver necesidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Yerlin M. is from the town of El Sauce. He has worked as a Municipal Security Guard for two years. He has had two Ceprodel loans for personal expenses. This loan is to cover some household needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay household expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta madre de familia de dos niños  y estos se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que va a reparar el techo de su casa de habitación.
Ella dice que gracias a  los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel  ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
This client is the mother of two children who are school aged. The requested loan is for building materials and supplies to repair her roof. She says that thanks to Ceprodel loans she has been able to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sereno Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Sereno C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como conserje en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  tres años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado dos créditos para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para seguir mejorando su vivienda y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sereno C. is from El Sauce. She works as a caretaker for the City of El Sauce. She’s been thus employed for three years. Ceprodel has granted her two loans for home improvements. The requested loan is to buy bricks, cement and sand and to pay for labor costs to continue making home improvements and provide her children with a better living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement and sand and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Susana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Susana  D. C.  vive en el Municipio del Viejo, Departamento de Chinandega.
Ella va a utilizar el credito en la compra de bolsas, Linazas, Chías, Cebadas, etc. Para su pequeño  ya que ella vende refrescos en su casa de habitación.

Además ella trabaja como profesora de Primaria en el Municipio de Pto. Morazán donde viaja todos los días de su casa  hacia su trabajo, ya que por la mañana su hija mayor mira la ventecita y por la tarde la cuida doña Susana.

Actualmente la Sra. D. C. ha adquirido 07 créditos con la Institución CEPRODEL,  donde todos los anteriores los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma y desea seguir trabajando por mucho mas tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Susana D. C. lives in El Viejo, Chinandega department. She will use the loan to buy bags, linseed, sage, barley, etc. for her small business since she sells beverages in her home. In addition, she works as an Elementary School Teacher in Puerto Morazán. She goes to work daily and while at work in the morning her daughter tends to the beverage sales and in the afternoon Susana tends to the stand. She has had seven CEPRODEL loans all of which she has repaid on time. She wants to continue working for a long time yet.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to make frozen fruit treats, bags for ice, gelatin, frozen popsicles, etc.

loans.name: Karla Vannesa

texts.es:
La   Sra. Karla A. A., trabaja como   Trabaja como Secretaria en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.                                                      
Es madre de familia de un  niño  y este se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para el pago de trámites de Diploma de su graduación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla A. A. is employed as a Secretary by the Autonomous University of Nicaragua. She is the mother of a school age son. She is asking for funds to pay for diploma and graduation expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for diploma and graduation expenses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amarilis Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar de gente trabajadora y honesta  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal “San Eduardo”.

Nació en Agua fría del cantón 24 de Mayo. Es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Desde los doce años  vino a Portoviejo a estudiar. Aprendió costura en la Academia Ángela Rosa Cevallos, trabajó en un taller de costura donde aprendió mucho. Después con la ayuda del crédito que recibió por parte de la Fundación Espoir compró una máquina de coser y ahora se dedica es su casa a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa en especial ropa de mujer, aunque le encanta coser ropa deportiva.

Trabaja todos los días de lunes  a viernes hasta las 17h00  en  un taller y en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día en su casa, algunas veces que tiene mucho trabajo una compañera de trabajo le ayuda.

Está en el Banco Comunal hace  8 años y está muy contenta porque le ayudado mucho. Con este nuevo crédito va a comprar una máquina de coser industrial recubridora para aumentar su producción.

Sus sueños son tener un gran taller y terminar su casa que esta aun en construcción.
texts.en:
The members of the San Eduardo communal bank meet on San Eduardo Street in Portoviejo, a place of honest, hard working people. She was born in Agua Fria, 24 de Mayo Canton. She’s married and has 4 children. She came to Portoviejo at the age of 12 to study. She learned sewing at the Ángela Rosa Cevallos Academy. She worked in a sewing workshop where she learned much. Later, with help from financing from Fundación Espoir, she bought a sewing machine and now she makes all kinds of clothes for women, although she loves making athletic clothes, at home. She works every day from Monday through Friday until 5pm in a workshop and at night and on weekends all day at home. Sometimes when she has a lot of work a coworker from work helps her. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she is very happy because it’s helped her a lot. She will use the new loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to increase production. Her dreams are to have a great workshop and to finish her house which is still under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Brenda José

texts.es: La Sra. Brenda C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como secretaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio el cual es un centro de estudios de primaria donde tiene 10 años de laborar. Tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de medicamentos para la buena salud de su mamá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda C. is from the city of El Sauce. She is currently employed as a Secretary at Simeón Pereira public school. It is a primary school and she’s worked there for 10 years. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for three years and has had three loans for personal expenses. The requested loan is to buy medicines for her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La Sra. Meris C. E. vive en el municipio del Viejo.
Ella va a utilizar el credito en la compra de mercadería para ser utilizada en su pulpería, ya que necesita surtirla  para satisfacer a todos sus clientes.

Este es el credito No. 31 que lleva con la Institución de los cuales todos los anteriores los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma, ya que es una persona muy Responsable y Honesta con todas sus obligaciones.

La Sra. C. E. tiene una edad de 63 años de edad y 15 años de experiencia en el rubro comercial y habita  solamente con su esposo ya que hijos nunca tuvo, pero ella nos ha manifestado que es una persona muy feliz con el y que espera seguir viviendo muchos años mas para manejar su negocio y seguir trabajando con CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meris C. E. lives in El Viejo. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store because she needs to stock it better in order to meet customer demand. This is her 31st loan with the Institution and she repaid all the previous ones on time because she’s a very responsible and honest person with respect to her commitments. Mrs. C. E. is 63 years old and has 15 years experience in commerce. She lives only with her husband since she never had children. She tells us that she’s very happy with him and hopes to continue living for many more years to run her business and continue collaborating with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech T., who was born in 1962, is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectare plot of land. She cultivates and sells rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chor Sem, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to improve rice production. Mrs. Pech T. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will hire farming laborers to grow the rice. She is the mother of four children: one is employed in a private company, while the others are studying in school.

Four members make up this group loan and they are villagers from Prey Slaeng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Pech T. is the group leader whom they have all selected. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Ta Reab Doun Sar village, Kandal province. Mrs. Uk N., age 49, is the leader of the group, having been selected by its members. Each member of this group loan will use their portion to support their different purposes.    
   
Mrs. Mrs. Uk N. earns a small income through her vegetable selling in the local market and is able to earn a small profit to support the family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She is married to Mr. Chhit Sarim, who is 50 years old and works as a construction worker as well as helping with his wife's business. 

This couple has two children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: La Sra. Anita P. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora en el cargo de Directora del centro de estudio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene 23 años de laborar. Es la primera ocasión que solicita crédito en Ceprodel para invertirlo en medicina y consulta médica para ella con el fin de mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anita P. is from the city of El Sauce. She is a teacher and is the Principal at Simeón Pereira School. She has worked in El Sauce for 23 years. This is her first loan from Ceprodel that she’ll use to buy medicine and pay for doctor’s office visit for herself in order to improve her health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La señora Lilia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal San Eduardo que se reúnen cada  quince días en la calle del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Portoviejo cerca de un hermoso parque llamado “El Mamey “.

Esta casada y tiene tres hijos y tres nietos, dos de hijos viven con ella. Es modista desde muy joven, estudio corte y confección en la Academia Esperanza Sacoto. Donde aprendió a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa aunque lo que mas le gusta es  hacer ropa de  mujer, dice que también hace camisas para hombre pero comenta que es mejor coser ropa de mujer ya que hay mas variedades.

Trabaja todos los días cuando hay bastante trabajo, tiene dos empleadas que trabajan con ella en su taller que está en su casa.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y otros productos que se requieren para la costura.
 
Sus sueños son que nunca le falte trabajo y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Lilia is a founding member of San Eduardo communal bank which meets every two weeks on San Eduardo Street in Portoviejo near a beautiful park called “El Mamey.” She is married and has three children and three grandchildren; two of the children still live with her. She has been a dressmaker since she was a young woman. She studied dressmaking at Esperanza Sacoto Academy where she learned how to make all kinds of clothes although what she likes best is to make women’s clothing. She says that she also makes men’s shirts but she comments that making women’s clothing is better because there is more variety. When there is enough work she works every day. She has two employees that work with her and her workshop is in her home. The loan will be used to buy fabric and other dressmaking supplies. Her dream is that she always has work and good health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan, and they are located in Ta Reab Doun Sa village, Kandal province. Mrs. Chea T., who was born in 1965, was selected as the group leader by its members. With the loans, the members of this group loan will use their portion to support different purposes. 

Mrs. Mrs. Chea T. and her husband, Mr. Kum Pheap, are fishermen, who are able to earn a small income to support the famiL.. They do not have enough money to buy some fishing supplies to support their business. Thus, Mrs. Chea T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and fishing supplies for fishing. They have six children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and fishing supplies for fishing.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mrs. Thon S. is a villager in Trapeang Phlu village in Takeo province, who was born in 1985. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Chan, is a construction worker and he also sells sand. Her problem is that is time to plow her field, but she does not have enough oxen to plow it. So, to improve her production Mrs. Thon S. is applying for a loan to buy an ox, and will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make more bamboo products

loans.name: Johana Margarita

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal San Eduardo que se reúnen cada  quince días en la calle del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Portoviejo cerca de un hermoso parque llamado “El Mamey “.

Encontramos a la señora Johana, está casada y tiene dos niñas una de ocho y otra hermosa bebita de un mes que son la luz de su vida comenta. Ella es nacida en Crucita (hermosa playa de Portoviejo) pero que desde se caso se vino a vivir a este lugar.
 
Desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero dice que le encanta hacer ropa para niños, ella comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y su casa, aunque ésta es de sus suegros. Dice que aquí  trabaja en sus obras por las noches, los sábados y domingos todo el día. Ella en el día trabaja un taller de costura por lo que aprovecha al máximo su tiempo libre para cumplir con sus contratos.

Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace ya tres ciclos y está muy contenta ya que le han ayudado mucho. Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar una maquina industrial para mejorar su producción.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The San Eduardo Communal Bank meets every two weeks on San Eduardo Street in Portoviejo near a beautiful park called “El Mamey.” We met with Johana who’s married and has two daughters one of whom is 8 years old and the other is a beautiful one-month-old baby. They are the light of her life, she says. She was born in Crucita (beautiful beach of Portoviejo) but came to live here when she got married. She has been a dressmaker for several years. She makes all kinds of clothes but she says what she likes best is to make children’s clothes. She combines her work with her household chores even though the house belongs to her in-laws. She says that she works on her projects during the night and all day on weekends. During the day she works at a sewing workshop so she uses her time to the maximum degree in order to complete her contracts. She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and is very happy because they have helped her much. The new loan will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve production. Her dream is to own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Koch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people, who are located in Trapeang Chrey village, Kandal province. Mrs. Koch Y., aged 69, was selected as the group leader by its members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Koch Y. and her husband, Mr. Suos Hang, are farmers who own 1.50-hectares of land where they cultivate peanuts and rice. This couple does not have any children who live with them, because their children are married. Now they have two grandchildren living with them, who all both students.
In order to pay for the grandchildren's school fees, Mrs. Koch Y. decided to ask for a loan, and will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support her agricultural machine for cultivating peanuts and rice.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., who was born in 1981, is a villager in Prey Ta Khab village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Roe Roem, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She also sells Khmer noodles, while her husband sells chickens in the local market where he is able to earn large profits to support his family.

Since her husband’s business is doing well, she wants to expand it. So, to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Sim P. is seeking a loan to buy more chickens to sell and will use the rest of the loan to buy four piglets and pig feed as part of a new business. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is studying in school, while the youngest one is four years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears on the photograph here. S. has spent almost all of her life cultivating crops. Growing potatoes is an activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant this crop twice a year and start growing in the rainy season. Her life partner is Samet, 30, a doctor working at the commune hospital. S. is a determined mother with a young child who depends on her income. S. will be using the loan she requested to buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump, and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump, and seeds.

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
Eight members are part of this village loan. Mrs. Nuon V., who was born in 1970, was selected as the village bank president by the group members. All members of this village loan live in Tuol Sankae village, Kandal province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve the living of their families.

Mrs. Nuon V. sells sand at home, while her husband, Mr. Khon Suy, who is 50 years old, works as a foreman worker.
