With the income from both of their occupations they are able to earn a small income to support the family. Mrs. Nuon V. will use the loan that she has asked for from AMK to buy more sand to sell. This couple has four children: one is a vehicle driver of goods, one is a construction worker, one is attending the local school,  while the other is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy more sand to sell.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny C. was born in Roluos village in Takeo province in 1985. She and her husband, Mr. Sophoun Souy, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She also sells beef at the local market, where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family, while her husband owns a mill.

It is time to grow the rice, but she does not have enough rice seed. So, to improve production Mrs. Ny C. is seeking a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to hire a plow machine to plow her field and farm laborers. She is a mother of two children who are both too small to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea C. is a married woman who lives in Palanas, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: hog raising, fish vending and farming. Her husband, Renaldo C., who is 64 years old, works as a fisherman/farmer. They have seven children between 21 and 40 years old. 

Matea joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21000 to buy feed, vitamins for the pigs and as additional capital for fish-vending so that she can continue to save up for the future and to support her family. Matea C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of pig feed and vitamins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem Y., who was born in 1962, was selected as the village bank president by the members of this village loan. They all live in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. Each member of the loan hopes to increase their income to improve their families' living.
  
Mrs. Kem Y. and her husband, Mr. Chaem Thorn, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. This couple are also farmers who work very hard to support their three children, who are seamstresses in a garment factory. In order to support the farming crop, Mrs. Kem Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for farm laborers to cultivate the rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for farm laborers to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita C. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 55 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Carmelita runs a general store selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5200 PHP a month.

Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Keak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Keak P., age 42, was selected as village bank president by the members of this village loan. They are all located in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.
     
Mrs. Keak P. is a grocery seller in the local village, while her husband, Mr. Sboang Rithy, 42, works as a police officer. With both of their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support the family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's living, and in order to expand the grocery business, Mrs. Keak P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. This couple has five children: three are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the other two are 5 and 1 and are not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Uong's Group

texts.en: Four members make up this group loan, and they live in Damnak village in Takeo province. Mr. Uong S. is the group leader, was born in 1943, and was selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family, and he is also a healer. Since his businesses are doing well, he wants to expand. So, to improve those businesses, Mr. Uong S. is applying for a loan to buy more medicine and also to buy fertilizer. He is a widower with two children, one of whom is a security guard, and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
There is a piece of farmland which Mrs. C. uses to farm different types of crops. C. and her husband have been spending their life in this sector since before they had children. This couple right now has three kids who attend school. 

C. is concerned that a lot of thick grass is growing on her farm field and the crop growth has been affected. To solve the problem, C. needs a loan to hire laborers to cut the grass from her land.

loans.use: To hire laborers to cut the grass from her land

loans.name: Nusa Sejahtera Group

texts.en: I Wayan N. is a 60-year-old male living in the town of Melaya, Bali. He is the group leader of this six-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nusa Sejahtera (PK-10266). I Wayan N. is married and has two adult children. He owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2008, I Wayan N. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. I Wayan N. is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be his 3rd from MUK. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** I Wayan N. 0 (0) merupakan 60 tahun pria. Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. I Wayan N. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 6 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Nusa Sejahtera (PK-10266). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. I Wayan N. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 11 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Wayan N. menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR. Dalam 2008, I Wayan N. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. I Wayan N. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,500,000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies
